results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes; timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Estate planning is not an easy topic people speak about, but it is necessary that all families need to.  The reality is, you've got to think about that day when you or a loved one won't be here anymore.  Estates  can be difficult to divide, and the presence of children or grandchildren can require a revision of existing estate plans.  Divorced, widowed and remarried people have other challenges in regards to estate planning.  We are honored to have A. Randall Drisgula, Esquire, speak about how to get your estate in order and avoid unnecessary inheritance and estate taxes.  Mr. Drisgula has been practicing law since 1972 and specializes in Elder Law, wills, powers of attorney, living wills, and estate planning and estate administration.

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on March 16th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Please join the NJIAMCP for an exciting sales training session being conducted by Kevin Shulman of Sandler Sales Training.   Kevin is a wise, dynamic, and funny sales trainer who can give you tips to help your business in the sales process.  This is a free session and normally this type of training would not come free.   We also have good food, coffee and ample networking opportunities.  

 We are going to talk about "Closing The Whale"

In this interactive session, Kevin will work with us on two things.  First, building a sales plan based on whether you should be fishing for whales, tuna, minnows, or anything in between.  Second, we'll discuss what it takes to find and close a whale.  Is the process really that different?  If so, how?  If not, why does it seem so much more difficult? 

Come prepared to participate.  Bring general questions, or specific questions about current deals you are working on.  

Kevin's Bio:


Kevin Shulman, the founder, President and CEO of Shulman & Associates, holds a B.S. in Psychology from the University of Southern California and worked toward a PhD. in Industrial Psychology at Wayne State University, Michigan, where he also taught undergraduate psychology.

Shortly after he left the university setting, Kevin founded, owned and operated a sales company for twelve years, taking it from zero to $20 million in sales.  After meeting David Sandler in 1990, Kevin became affiliated with the Sandler Sales Institute, a nationally recognized sales training company.  In 1991, he founded Shulman & Associates and has since become the senior New Jersey affiliate of Sandler Training.

Kevin trains and coaches individuals as well as companies and professional firms in selling, negotiating, networking, recruiting, prospecting, and management strategies. He teaches a proven system that enables business owners, sales managers, and sales people to grow their business and reach their full potential in the process. 

Kevin Shulman, highly regarded as a business development expert, can be found frequently on the road, conducting in-house workshops for major corporations.  He has trained in venues as diverse as Las Vegas and Madison Square Garden. He is also regularly asked to assist in the training and development of other sales trainers nationwide. 

Kevin is also an active volunteer at the Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York.  He is a former president of EEI, one of the premier networking groups for executives in New Jersey. 

Shulman & Associates has three locations in New Jersey: Edison, Short Hills and Red Bank. For more information, contact Shulman & Associates at
(732) 767 – 5351 or visit the Web site at http://www.WeExpectSuccess.com.

The New York Metro Adaptive User Group provides an opportunity and forum for local Adaptive users to facilitate learning by sharing ideas, experiences, and software best practices to maximize your Adaptive investment. It’s also a great networking opportunity to allow you to meet and reach out to other local Adaptive users. All Adaptive users in the tri-state area are encouraged to attend this event.

The first 30 people who register for the user group event will receive a 50% off discount to the Adaptive Live registration fee.

In addition, we will be providing one complimentary pass to the Adaptive Live 2016 event! We will have a drawing at the event for the winner of the complimentary pass.  You must be present to win.

results.description:
Bootstrapping Patent Protection for your Unique Software Idea


Patents are a powerful tool for protecting your unique software idea. This workshop focuses on how patents can help you build value for your software startup or mature company - increasing your company’s valuation by $1 million or more. 

Join us to learn:

• Is your idea patent-worthy? 
• You and your patent: getting it done 
• Time & money – how to make a patent affordable 
• Do you need a patent? Alternatives to patent protection

Program Schedule 

8:30 a.m. - 9 am 
Registration check-in & continental breakfast 

9 a.m. – 10 a.m. 
Presentation

10 a.m. – 10:30 a.m. 


Q&A and wrap-up


About the speaker:


Dr. D'vorah Graeser, KISSPatent


Dr. D’vorah Graeser is a US Patent Agent with 19 years of experience in obtaining patent protection for her software clients, particularly for software startups. Her firm, KISSPatent, is based in Chicago, Illinois (USA).  KISSPatent is a new venture being incubated within this firm; it brings more affordable patent services to entrepreneurs and startups in the software area, as well as detailed information about patents (www.kisspatent.com).

results.description:
Following Passive House principles, the SURE house uses 90% less energy than its conventional cousins. It fully powers itself through solar energy, and it is built from repurposed fiber-composite materials pioneered through the boat building industry. These strategies produce a home that drastically reduces its contribution to global climate change, while providing an excellent living environment and bracing for the effects of sea level rise, and increasingly severe storms.

Join Building Energy Exchange for a presentation of the SURE House, 2015 winner of the US DOE's Solar Decathlon from the students and faculty at The Stevens Institute of Technology (SIT).  The team received first place overall in the October 2015 competition, winning first place for an unprecedented 7 individual awards including Architecture, Market Appeal, Engineering, Communications, Commuting, Appliances, and Home-Life. 

Faculty and student team leaders will present the project in depth, looking at the design process and issues surrounding flood-proof, low energy homes as well as the construction sequence. The team will also offer a behind-the-scenes look at performance data collected during the 10-day competition in Irvine, CA, including the home's energy generation, energy consumption, and interior comfort data.

- Click Here to Register -

SPEAKERS


Ed May, Faculty Project Manager, Stevens Institute
Elizabeth Lamb, Student Team Member, Stevens Institute
AJ Elliott, Student Electrical Engineer, Stevens Institute
Chris Hamm, Student Energy Engineer & Construction Manager, Stevens Institute

SCHEDULE
8:30 Registration & Coffee
9:00 Presentation
10:10 Moderated Discussion & Q&A
10:30 Close


- Click Here to Register -

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
Join us for a real-life game of whodunit at one of the best museums in the world!

It's a race to find the murderer in this two-hour competition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Your group will be whisked away to a secret location inside the museum and it's there that you'll receive all the gory details. There's a dead body in the museum and it's your job to find the murderer before they escape.


Your group will race to solve clues, finish challenges, and decode the mystery. Guides will pop up along the way with crazy facts and stories about pieces in the museum.


When time's up, your group will reveal your findings, a winner will be crowned, and prizes will be handed out. 

The Murder Mystery is totally free to attend, but you'll need to get your own museum admission. Admission is "pay what you want" and the Met suggests a donation of $25 but it's completely okay to donate $5 or even $1 if you like.
results.name: Murder Mystery at the Met

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

Craft: A Screenwriting Intensive with Jessica Hinds


What is the fastest most efficient way to master something? Repetition. Repetition. Repetition. In this class, you will be focusing strictly on the craft of screenwriting, instead of the art. By stepping away and separating yourself from things like story and characters, you'll have the opportunity to really dig in and sharpen your craft, so it's the most effective tool in your arsenal.

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT THIS CLASS:

Before they ever step out onto the field, pitchers train. 

A pitcher will throw curveball after curveball after curve ball until his body memorizes exactly what it needs to do…and so should writers. We must have the muscle memory of the strongest execution of Action, Dialogue and Structure so we can forget it and focus on our story.

In this four week class you will get the in-depth attention to your craft and the repetition you need to make sure that every scene you write is as powerful as it can be. A combination of lecture, in class exercises and at home assignments will throw you into the fast lane of mastering Formatting, Structure, Action and Dialogue. After mastering the craft you will be able to write faster and more effectively. Don’t be surprised if your first drafts start looking like third drafts and writing becomes more fun and free. Learn to instinctively turn what you see in your head into a scene on the page in a way that anyone could read and not just understand but actually see and feel.

Whether you are a new writer looking to develop your skills or a professional screenwriter looking to sharpen the well-worn down tools in your tool box, this class is the fast, fun and effective way to make readers, producers and agents see your film rather than just read your screenplay.

<a href="http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com/meditative-writing-nyc-online/"></a>

----

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class size is strictly limited. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

Please plan on staying for the entire duration of the class.

results.name: The Screenwriting Craft Intensive with Jessica Hinds

results.description:
Do you often find yourself having little control over your emotions?

Do you experience anxiety and want to overcome it?

Do you act impulsively and later regret your actions?

If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this meditation is for YOU!

"Thoughts," according Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard, "can be our best friends and our worst enemies."

Osho Says, "the mind can be a beautiful servant, or a dangerous master." 

In this guided meditation call, we will learn how to observe our own thoughts and cultivate the space between our thoughts. This space is often referred to as nirvana, ecstasy, and enlightenment.  When we enter this space we have total control over our emotions and actions. 


Until what is on the inside - that is, your mind - is corrected, the external world, that is, how you perceive and experience the world around you will be a mere reflection of it.

We will learn an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic technique taught by Indian enlightened master Paramahamsa Nithyananda, called "unclutching." In this technique we learn how to master our thoughts, and as a result control our emotions. 

Join me on this enlightening 45 minute experience! 

In love and abundance, 

Ayelet Shimron 

http://ayeletshimron.com/

www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron


[masked]-GOAL 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers:

"Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. It's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I haven't come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

The meditation helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

results.description:
Agenda: 

Currently most of our software is written in standard ES5. We all want to be writing in the newer ES2015 style. But how exactly do you convert existing projects that are ES5 based into ES2015 projects? 

How do you do it safely, whilst maintaining linting and testing for large projects where the best you can hope for is to convert some small sub folder in any given afternoon?What are the benefits of moving forwards. How do you justify meddling with an already working project when it appears that you cannot earn money from converting it? Why bother?

I am going to address the how and the why of moving your dusty old ES5 projects into shinny fun ES2015 projects that allows you to use all the newer features of the javascript language. Trust me your code will never have looked so good once you move on.

Bio:

I was born London in 1967 (yeah, I missed that world cup win). I Graduated in 1992 with an MSc in Satellite and Telecommunications Engineering, BSc in electrical engineering.

I have been writing software since 1981, I can be pretty exact about it https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZX81. I am a pre-internet educated individual. 

I have worked in:

Avionics( Boeing, Airbus, flight computers, head up displays)

Satellite Communications ( Inmarsat, modems etc )

Wireless Technology (AT&T)

Fibre Optic Startup ( Dot com bust #1 )

Finance (hedge funds http://www.scm-lp.com/ )

Remote sensing data hosted online (http://www.dataonline.com)

Video streaming (http://kiswe.com) 

So if you have ever heard of those old time languages like assembler, C, C++. I once did that. I’ve been through every software fad, written code, masqueraded in management and finally came back to my senses to just learn and love a most amazing profession. We now have more resources and more chances to do great things than I could have imagined back in 1981.

I am now a full time node developer working at a live video sports streaming startup and really enjoying myself.
results.name: Converting a Node.js Project from ES5 to ES2015 - Glenn Hinks

results.description:
Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 26 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.

Tech Job Fair @ Byte Academy


New York Software Engineers is pleased to announce a Software and Data Science Job Fair.

Date: March 16, 2016

Time: 5:30-9 PM

Location: Byte Academy, 295 Madison Avenue, 35th Floor, New York, NY

Projected Schedule:

5:30-7:15 PM Network with other attendees, Book appointments with company representatives

5:45-8 PM Appointments with company representatives (first come, first served)

8-9 PM Mingle with the companies and other attendees

Representatives from a number of NYC-area software companies will be available to recruit for their software and data science roles and answer any questions you have.  Upon entering, you will have the opportunity to book appointments with the companies of your choice.

The focus will be on Python, Data Science, Java and related disciplines.  Refreshments will be served.

Attendance is free.  Booths are $400 ($325 on or before March 10) and can be ordered here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tech-job-fair-byte-academy-tickets-22419435134.  Please also contact Rebecca with any questions.

About Byte Academy : Byte Academy offers intensive full and part-time courses that emphasize full-stack programming using Python and industry-oriented programs such as FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech. Both beginners and advanced are welcome, with advanced being able to skip a phase via our Jump Program. Byte Academy is the first coding bootcamp in the world to offer a FinTech (financial technology) program and the first in New York City to teach full stack Python. Small classes, career services and access to top industry professionals and events are included.  Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 scholarships. Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for courses which start every 4 weeks.

*Byte Academy was just nominated for the Benzinga FinTech Awards, please vote here to show support*

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club”   Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving).

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like!


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!


There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!


The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see!
￼￼
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

FAQs

• What kinds of people will attend as job applicants?

The developers that attend these kinds of fairs tend to be at a variety of levels, based on the people that have contacted me.  Registrants seem typical for a NY Software Engineers job fair, of which there have been several in the past. 

Since the applicants will be booking individual appointments, you can request applicants of particular levels and specialties.  When the applicants are making appointments, I would steer the ones you might want to meet with toward you.

Email Rebecca Sealfon at [masked].

No.

results.description:
Want to visit the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum for FREE?  I had a generic Meetup event scheduled for the Smithsonian Museum Day Live event as a "no host" activity.  However, since so many people seemed interested in visiting the Intrepid I thought it would be helpful to list that as a separate event.  I wish I could join you!  Andrea and Veena indicated they would be there so look for them.

Have fun!

There are a variety of New York-area museums participating in the Smithsonian-sponsored annual Museum Day Live event, a nationwide program that offers free one-day museum admission to several different venues.  Participating museums include: 

 - Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum


 - The Museum of the City of New York

 - and many others, please see list on the link below

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/museumday/venues/museum-day-live-march-2016/

This year's event is Saturday, March 12. Unfortunately I will be out of town during on this date, and will thus be unable to attend.  However, I wanted to post this information anyway because this a great opportunity to visit some great museums, for free.

Perhaps a couple members of the group can "host" this event?  As host you would just figure which museum to go to, where to meet the group (at the main entrance?), answer any questions people may have beforehand, help guide the group through the museum, etc.  Being a host is pretty simple and I can help with any questions you may have.

If no one is able to help lead this event I'll just leave it on the calendar as a "no host" event and you can stop by on your own and tour a museum - for free.

Please note that if you are attending this event I strongly recommend arriving early (when the museum first opens?) to avoid the crowds that are bound to show up for this free event.  Also, if you are attending you need to register beforehand for your free ticket via the Smithsonian web site (so they know how many people will be attending).  Link provided below:  

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/museumday/museum-day-live-march-2016/

Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

Pier 86, West 46th Street & 12th Avenue, New York, NY, 10036

[masked]

Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum Website »

GET TICKETS
results.name: Smithsonian Museum Day - Free Admission to Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Join us as we share current challenges in advance of the OpenStack Austin Summit. We will also learn from Trilio Data and Cumulus Networks. 

Agenda: 

6:00 - 6:25 Food and Drinks

6:30 - 6:55 Pre-Summit Challenges Chat 

7:00 - 7:25 Exclusive Preview of the First Native Backup and Recovery Solution for OpenStack by David and Murali from Trilio Data 

7:30 - 7:55 Cumulus Networks - Routing on the host in an OpenStack environment

8:00 - 9:00 Drinks 

Meet Your Speakers:

David Safaii, is CEO of Trilio Data. Prior to joining Trilio Data, David was founder and SVP of BurstPoint Networks. During his tenure with the company, he successfully raised venture funding, grew revenues and exited with an acquisition by Avaya. Previously, David was a Principal at Windspeed Ventures, focusing on investing in and working with portfolio companies in infrastructure software as it relates to the digital media, communications, mobile, security, storage, internet of things and software as a service markets. He helped manage one of the largest venture portfolios in the US. Prior to his tenure at Windspeed, David served with the Technology Investment Banking Group at CIBC World Markets.

Murali Balcha, co-founder and CTO of Trilio Data, is one of the co-authors of the first specification for OpenStack Backup-as-a-Service, called Raksha. For over 15 years Murali has served in key technical and leadership roles, delivering breakthrough technologies to market. Most recently, he served as an Engineering Leader at EMC, where he led the development of numerous storage, virtualization, and cloud computing innovations and established EMC’s leadership in Disaster Recovery, and VMware Integration

Jason Heller is a Senior Consultant with Cumulus Networks. He started his networking career at Cisco Systems, working for over 10 years in the CPOC (Customer Proof of Concept Lab) and ECATS (Enhanced Customer Aligned Testing Services) groups. As a technical projects engineer at Cisco, he worked on the design, implementation and testing for many of the largest service provider and enterprise networking customers in the world. Prior to his networking life, he worked as a systems administrator for several North Carolina ISPs, managing a mixture of Solaris and Red Hat servers. He brings the experience from both of these worlds to Cumulus Networks, helping customers deploy modern Open Networking data centers by utilizing the power of Linux for their networks as well as their servers.
results.name: The Future of OpenStack: Austin Summit Pre-Talks/ Cumulus Networking

results.description:
THE SCENE:

Your hosts Audrey Pellicano and Nancy Gershman placing you at tables of 4, with free-flowing conversation over pots of mint tea and small plates - unhindered by facilitators, speakers or agendas. Still in deep conversation at 7:30? Stay longer and convey your appreciation to our hosts by ordering additional dishes, desserts, or drinks from the bar. Special guest: Kyle McAuley, audio engineer from America's Test Kitchen, to record the sounds of an actual Death Café for their radio program out of Boston. (Want to opt out? We'll seat you at the "recording-free" table.)

SOUNDBITES FROM OUR TABLES:

There are so many terrific conversations going on at Death Café NYC. If you would like to share one of those comments on Soundbites from Our Tables (it's one of our Death Café NYC Meetup.com pages), please share it with Nancy; post it on our Facebook page, or email us through Meetup.com so we can add them to the collection.

FACEBOOK:

LIKE Death Café NYC on Facebook to get some of the brain-sharpening items and announcements we don’t email you through Meetup.com:

 News you can use (and haven't heard before)  Discount tickets to lecture series, art talks and more  Live film screenings including Q&As with the directors  Early peeks at upcoming exhibitions (such as the Metropolitan Museum of Art/ Costume Institute's show, “Death Becomes Her”)

See you soon!

Audrey and Nancy
results.name: DEATH CAFE NYC: Wed, March 16 at Tagine

TO ALL INVENTORS WITH THAT GREAT "IDEA"YOUR INVITED TO "PITCH A PRODUCT™" NIGHT at MICROSOFT..  ANDREA ROSE® & HER MARKETING ASSOCIATES ARE LOOKING FOR THAT NEXT "WINNING" PRODUCT TO BRING TO MARKET!!

We are excited to announce at ‘The Inventors Road Show™” our  workshop “Pitch a Product™”.   Award winning inventor Andrea Rose® will facilitate the evening helping the group  learn how to present their products to market while on the lookout for that next “Winning” product to introduce to her marketing associates that include such companiesas"As Seen On TV , mass retailers. international distributors and television home shopping companies to name a few. We are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!


Attendees will have “5 minutes” to pitch their inventions to the group.  This workshop helps inventors learn how to present their “Ideas to Industry™”.  It also helps them discover how to look at their inventions as a solution to a problem that is needed in the marketplace.  To have a successful  “product/invention”  it must fill a need in the marketplace and this workshop explores this very important aspect of inventing.  During each workshop we discuss  other various topics that provide the attendees with the tools they will need  to turn their "Idea" into a commercial success.  All inventors are welcome!!!

NOTE:  Andrea Rose® is an award winning inventor who has alliances with companies that provide services to inventors.  We at "The Inventors Road Show™" are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!!  Andrea will be providing the group with her expert advice and looking for the next  "Winning" invention to present to her marketing partners.

Andrea does one on one consulting for inventors who are seeking personalize assistance. For more information contact:  [masked]

DISCLAIMER:  Andrea Rose® is not an attorney and does not provide any legal advice to any inventor. All inventors  pitching and presenting their inventions in the workshop should have filed for a provisional patent, have a patent-pending or an issued patent if they choose to participate in giving a pitch to the group.  Otherwise their idea could loose the legal  protection that is provided by filing for a patent.  It will be at the discretion of the inventor if they want to pitch their product.

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description:
If you are a screenwriter, this is the meetup you should not miss every month. Share your work, listen to the work of other writers, and also take advantage of the monthly educational resource, entertainment attorney Hakim Mulraine.

In past committee meetings, we have spoken with Reggie Bythewood, Michael Starburry, Devanshi Patel and Sheldon Candis, as well as participated in many table reads. If you are a writer, the writers committee is a great resource!

We have room for pages from one more script to be table read at this week's upcoming Writer's Committee Meeting. Please send your pages to [masked] (no more than 8 pages via pdf).

In addition to the table read, we also have a great industry resource lined up. Attendees will have the opportunity to hear from entertainment attorney and deal architect, Hakim Mulraine. 

Hakim will frame his discussion around the what we can do as writers to increase our chances of successfully attracting the human and financial resources to get our work made. Speaking briefly on the reality of deal making versus the fantasy, he will dig into the components of a properly packaged project, as well as answer questions that you may have about protecting your work, whether you should ask prospective producers and financiers to sign an NDA before reading your script, what to look for in option agreements and more. 

He will also take questions from the audience. 

Hakim Mulraine Bio

Hakim Mulraine is an entertainment and business law attorney as well as and owner of the newly formed, Bronx Born Media, LLC. With over a decade of industry experience and a strong professional circle, Hakim has provided services for: producers, screenwriters, talent and private equity. Through his entertainment law firm and production company, he has assisted clients with developing, packaging, financing and pitching projects to entertainment and new media entities. His knowledge base includes a strong foundation in entertainment, business, contract, copyright, trademark, publishing and new media law.  Hakim has also developed strong ties with private equity firms and angel investors seeking investment opportunities in entertainment and new media projects. 

Born and raised in Bronx New York, Hakim received his B.A. in Political Science from Manhattanville College and a J.D from the University at Buffalo, School of Law (UB Law).  He also holds a Certificate in Entertainment & Media Management from New York University.  Hakim started his own law practice in Westchester County in 2008, The Law Office of Hakim Mulraine, which was later renamed, The Mulraine Firm.  His firm also uses a satellite office in New York City.
results.name: The Collective Writer's Committee

results.description: Just where does your money, in all its various forms, (cash, electronic, credit) come from? Does government create money by printing the banknotes and minting the coins in circulation? Are bank just intermediaries, borrowing from savers and lending to borrowers? What does the banking system do with the money in your accounts? How does the banking system create money and credit? And just where does all that money and credit go, and who benefits? In this interactive seminar, presented by Allen Smith, you will learn the answers to these questions, and understand why the answers really matter to you and yours.

results.description:
Marquesa Pettway will walk you through all the key steps in order to gain a client, whether you’re selling online or speaking in front of large audiences.


As the creator of Speakerpreneur ™, a term used to describe entrepreneurs who use their voice to grow their buisness. Ms. Pettway, a business reinvention expert, teaches entrepreneurs how to attract clients and earn income by using their voice to grow their business. She’s coached hundreds of entrepreneurs and professionals to profitable businesses since 2005. Your voice is everything in business, it’s your negotiation tool, credibility builder and business generator. Marquesa breaks it down and helps you reinventsyour idea into a business!


Marquesa Pettway, CSP, a designation awarded to less than 700 speakers in the world, DTM, a Business Reinvention Expert, Professional Speaker, Author of The Reinvention Roadmap, SpeakerTalk Radio host (on itunes) and the founder and chief coach of The National Center for Speaker Training.


Marquesa provides the “how” in her Reinvention Roadmap™ and SpeakerBlueprint Roadmap and many other business boosting programs via THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR SPEAKER TRAINING. She’s recognized an as expert by New York Newsday. Les Brown, the internationally renowned motivational speaker, calls her a brilliant speaker and business coach. Associate Producer for CNN Small Business show, “Managing with Lou Dobbs” turned Biz Reinvention Coach to hundreds of entrepreneurs and hundreds of organizations since 1993. The New York Daily News quoted her as a “guru”. New York based expert, Marquesa Pettway ALSO reinvents organizations. Ms. Pettway is a columnist for Speaker Magazine and was featured in Toastmasters Magazine in August 2015. She was also featured on the Voices of Experience Digital Magazine for Speakers Twice; She serves as the Live Broadcasting Host for Women Speakers Association. She’s spoken all over the world in every single state and a few countries, including hosting business pitch sessions.
results.name: Win Over New Clients presented by Marquesa Pettway

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

group.name: Free and Affordable Yoga, Meditation, African Dance Classes

results.description:
Gallery Talk:

Don Perlis and David Carbone

March 16, 2016
6:30pm- 8pm

Denise Bibro Fine Art in Chelsea at 529 W. 20th Street, fourth floor, is pleased to announce an intimate artist talk with David Carbone, writer for such publications such as Modern Painters and Art Critical and an Associate Professor of Drawing and Painting at the University of Albany. He will be conversing with artist Don Perlis whose show New York Now is on display at the gallery.

Don Perlis is a seasoned artist with multiple solo shows, including numerous shows with Denise Bibro Fine Art. He is a member of the National Academy of Design and his work is included is in many private and public collections. He has been reviewed in noted publications such as Art in America and the New York Times. Available for purchase: Don Perlis: Color illustrated catalogue featuring the introduction by Oscar-winning actor F. Murray Abraham with essays by noted Art historian/Art Critic Donald Kuspit and Art Historian Stanley Grand. The artist will be available to sign. There will be a Q and A session following the talk and a small reception afterwards.

For information, or to request high resolution images, contact the gallery at: [masked]

www.denisebibrofineart.com

529 West 20th Street, #4W
New York, NY 10011
[masked]
Tues-Sat 11am-6pm

results.description: This Week -----> BRING A LAPTOP. This is a hands-on workshop, where you should be prepared to bring in your laptop to do actual coding. But if you just want feedback on your site, you can bring it in on a flash drive. Design and build your own website, while getting support from an instructor as well as fellow students. It doesn't matter what point you are in the web design process. Bring in whatever you have, from a design to coded files. If you have not started yet, come in with your idea and start working during the meetup.

results.description:
Come out and enjoy a movie on us! Download your pass while supplies last. Join us for an advance screening of Midnight Special

For free ticket information and entry PLEASE READ IN FULL THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW.

FOLLOW THESE INSTRUCTIONS FOR YOUR FREE PASSES

★Click on the link below.

★Sign up 

★If tickets are still available, you will receive an email confirmation. PRINT OUT YOUR TICKET CONFIRMATION – That means the confirmation you get from the movie ticketing site. (In the past some of our members mistakenly brought the MeetUp confirmation instead). Don’t think you can show it on your phone, you must print it out. 

“bring with them the printed pass that they download from WB Tickets (link below, while supplies last). Talent will be in attendance and all pertinent details (dress code, arrival, etc.) will be on the ticket under SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS.” 

★Let us know in the Comment section below if when you receive a confirmation email. (Also, feel free to ask questions if you are encountering obstacles.)

  ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦ Important, please keep reading ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

Suggested arrival time is between 1 hour early. You will need to get in line with all other people trying to get into the free movie. The movie begins at 7. This is first come, first serve. If you show up too late, you may not get in. You also want to come early if you come with someone to make sure that you can sit together.

DO NOT SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO ATTEND OR YOU THINK SOMETHING WILL COME UP. The promo company receives the names of all who sign up and can see who does not use their ticket. Your no-show can affect future free movie offers and we don’t want to mess that up!

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

⍟ MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL ADDRESS FOR UPDATES. 

⍟ RSVPing here on MeetUp alone does not get you a movie pass. Follow the above instructions for your tickets. 

⍟ Security will require ID. 

⍟ AGAIN, MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL FOR UPDATES! 

Download tickets at the link below while supplies last.

Ticket does not guarantee admission. Seating is limited and based on a first-come, first-serve basis. Arrive early. Latecomers will not be admitted.

WB Tickets Link: http://www.wbtickets.com/FtGqe53851

Screening starts on time. Arrive early. Seating is first-come, first-serve. Theater is overbooked to ensure capacity. Latecomers will not be admitted.

Must show ID. Only the person whose name is on the pass may use the pass. Tickets will only be given to guests who are present. Arrive with your entire party to be seated promptly.

www.midnightspecialmovie.com

https://youtu.be/oVgxxdu-gJc

Writer/director Jeff Nichols proves again that he is one of the most compelling storytellers of our time with the sci-fi thriller “Midnight Special.” A provocative, genre-defying film as supernatural as it is intimately human, it follows a father, Roy (Michael Shannon), who goes on the run to protect his young son, Alton (Jaeden Lieberher), a boy with mysterious powers that even Roy himself cannot comprehend.

What starts as a race from religious extremists and local law enforcement quickly escalates to a nationwide manhunt involving the highest levels of the Federal Government. Risking everything, Roy is committed to helping Alton reach his ultimate purpose, whatever that might be and whatever it costs, in a story that takes audiences on a perilous journey from Texas to the Florida coast, while exploring the bonds of love and trust, and the nature of faith.
results.name: Advance Movie Screening: "Midnight Special"

results.description:
This is a free event for MetroNY AWIS members!  We just ask that you reserve your spot with a $20 deposit, which will be refunded to you immediately after event attendance.

Non-members: $20

How many times have you been looking for a job and felt like it was a nightmare?  The recruiter never calls you back, the job boards feel like a black hole, the job descriptions are vague, etc.  Then, you finally get an interview but you're not so sure what to expect or how to be? We've all been there before.  It's frustrating.  Thankfully, there are some simple tips and tricks to ensure that - a) your resume is getting in front of the hiring manager & b) you are well prepared once you are at the interview.

Emily Juricek is a Life and Career Coach, specializing on working with people who are feeling lost and unmotivated in their current job and want to create a more fulfilling career.  She partners with her clients to support them in discovering their true passion, and what steps they need to take to create the life they want. 


In this presentation, Emily Juricek will discuss:

-The most effective ways to work with agencies/recruiters

- A "behind the scenes" look at how the process works on our end

- Resume writing, including formatting tips, keywords, and how to effectively "sell" your experience by your resume

- How to get your resume in front of the hiring manager

- General interview etiquette tips

- Prepping for challenging questions 

- Closing the interview (good questions to ask/how to get next steps/thank you emails)

There will also be the opportunity to network with fellow scientists in NYC!  Pizza and soda will be served.

Emily is a graduate of the Accomplishment Coaching Life Coach Training Program. Aside from her private practice, Emily also trains and coaches participants in the San Diego and NYC Accomplishment Coaching Training Programs.  Prior to her training as a Life Coach, she worked in Recruiting and Sales for five years, and has coached hundreds of professionals through career transitions.  Emily also hosts career seminars and motivational speeches, focusing specifically on individuals who are looking to take their career to the next level.
results.name: Stepping into the Job Market: Self-Branding and Empowerment

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

We will  be located in the restaurant by the windows.


Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consume something.


• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located in the restaurant by the windows
results.name: Wednesday board gaming in Valley Stream

Owners, hiring managers, entrepreneurs & job-seekers are welcome to attend. Complimentary, light refreshments will be served. Business/Business casual attire preferred.

results.description:
Please come share your “wealth” of experiences, ideas, feelings, values, and insights about:

* What does “Wealth” mean to you?
* Wealth and Happiness – What’s the connection?
* How much do we really need?
* Should everything be for sale?
* What’s real “wealth”?
* What have you learned about creating wealth?
* How is wealth effecting our community?
* What’s wealth doing to our city
and to our politics?


A few great "reads" on the subject: The Gospel of Wealth by Andrew Carnegie; Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill; Common Wealth: Economics for a Crowded Planet by Jeffrey D. Sachs; Saving Capitalism: For the Many, Not the Few by Robert B. Reich; What Money Can’t Buy: The Moral Limits of Markets by Michael Sandel;  Dark Money by Jane Mayer.


NEXT SESSIONS IN THIS MONTHLY SERIES: Wed., April 20; Wed., May 18; Wed., June 8.  (All 6:15-8:00 pm)


Conversations New York (www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which has promoted more and better conversations among New Yorkers by such activities as an annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park, an on-line calendar featuring 1,000 conversations a year, and the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation held at Columbia University.
results.name: WEALTH: What does it mean to you, and what is it doing to us?  with Ron Gross

results.description:
Curious about the magic loop as an alternative to double pointed needles?  In this 2 hour workshop, you'll learn how to knit using the magic loop technique, which can be used for knitting in the round, and especially on those projects with a small circumference.

Stop there if you want, but if you're up for the challenge, I'll also show you how to cast on to knit two at a time on the magic loop.  This is a great technique for socks, mittens, or sleeves because it ensures you're making the two exactly the same, and you don't have to worry about what happens when you finish one and have absolutely no desire to do another...

Prerequisite:

This is not a learn to knit class, so you should already know how to knit.


Materials:

Bring two balls of yarn in the same weight, but ideally in two different colors and an appropriately sized circular needle, at least 32" - 48" in length.

If you came to this workshop before, please feel welcome to come again and we can pick up where you left off, improving your understanding of this technique.
results.name: Knitting Workshop - Magic Loop & 2 at a time

results.description:
Important:

- You will need to bring your laptop for this! ;)

- You need to know how to use a prototyping tool (any tools of your choice like InVision or Principle for Mac, Pixate, Axure, etc., etc.)- You do not need to know how to code

- You do not need to know how to code

*************


Hey Everyone,

For our first meetup, we'll try a “Hackers for Good” event. We are collaborating with Francesco Bertocci, who is also running the "Prototyping User Experiences" meetup so you can RSVP here or on their event page (http://www.meetup.com/Prototyping-User-Experiences-NYC-Meetup/events/229440317/).


The idea is to have a “brief” with the goal to solve a real world problem – for this event, it could be Save The Children or NYC City Harvest.


You’ll have approximately 2 hours to:


- Design and build a prototype that “tells” your way to solve the problem. (You can choose any any prototyping tool you like from InVision, to Principle for Mac or Pixate, etc.)


You need to bring a laptop and be ready to prototype. 


Participants will be able to work individually or in a team of 2-4 people.


After completing the prototypes, you’ll have 3-5 minutes to present your work, if you’d like feedback.


The “winners” and “honorable mentions” will be picked by a panel (TBD) and / or popular vote.


Prizes for this mini hackathon are “good karma” in various sizes ;)


If we have a sponsor by the time of the event we might have a real prize as well, but cannot promise that yet.


We will be helping with any prototyping questions you might have.


Look forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: UX Prototyping - Mini Hackathon

results.description:
IMPORTANT: 
to participate effectively in this hackathon, bring your laptop with your favorite prototyping tools already installed and a way to sketch your ideas and flows before you design or build them.

-------

Hello Everyone,

for our third meetup we'll try a “Hackers for Good” event. We are collaborating with Michael Lapin at “Product and UX Hackathons” meetup group so you can RSVP here or on their event page.

The idea is to have a “brief” with the goal to solve a real world problem – in first event could be for example for Save The Children or NYC City Harvest.

You’ll have approximately 2 hours to:

– Design and build a prototype that “tells” your way to solve the problem

– You can use any prototyping tool of your choice from InVision, to Principle for Mac, code it if you prefer or use a text messaging platform if you prefer.

When the teams are done, you’ll have 3-5 minutes to present your prototype, if you’d like feedback.

Teams can be solo teams (one member) or up to 3-4 members.

The “winners” and “honorable mentions” will be picked by a panel (TBD) and by popular vote.

Prizes for this hackaton are “good karma” in various sizes ;)

If we have a sponsor by the time of the event we might have a real prize too, but can’t promise yet.

I'll be helping with any prototyping questions you might have.

See you soon! 

Francesco
results.name: UX Prototyping - Mini Hackathon

results.description:
Andrea Arcangeli

-on-

Virtual Memory management and Virtualization in the Linux Kernel

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wednesday Mar 2nd, 2016, 4:30pm.


Andrea will provide a high level perspective of the most notable milestones in the longterm evolution of the Linux Virtual Memory and Virtualization subsystems. In addition, Andrea will explore recent advances in Memory Management related to the KVM Virtualization Hypervisor, such as THP, KSM, NUMA balancing, and userfaultfd/postcopy live migration. Andrea will cover best practices, providing the audience with an understanding of when and how to leverage these features in their environments.

Links:

Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at Jake's Saloon where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. Jake's Saloon is located at 23rd and 7th Ave. We'll be meeting at the tables near the back.

Speaker Bio:
Andrea Arcangeli joined Qumranet and then Red Hat in 2008 because of his interest in working on the KVM Virtualization Hypervisor, with a special interest in virtual machine memory management. Before joining Qumranet, he worked for Novell/SUSE for 9 years. He worked on many parts of the Linux Kernel, especially on the Virtual Memory subsystem. Andrea started working with Linux in his spare time shortly after first connecting to the internet back in 1996 while studying at University. He enjoys spending most of his time solving software problems and promoting the adoption of Linux and Open Source software everywhere.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the far elevator bank to get to the 2nd floor.

results.description:
Come join us for a 30 minute HU Song with time for fellowship and refreshments afterwards.

 HU is an ancient name for God. Singing it is a love song to God.  It is a wonderful way to open your heart to the Light and Sound of God. By singing it you can bring peace and calmness into your life, find answers and experience the Divine Love of God.  It is a wonderful way to daily put yourself in alignment with your highest consciousness.

Here is a simple way to experience the HU.  First, close your eyes and look gently to a point between your eyebrows.  Then, softly sing HU (pronounced like the word "hue").  Now sit quietly for a few minutes.  Watch and listen for the presence of God.  It may come as a light or a sound or in some other way.

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING


This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
Andrew Jackson's Democratic Party dominated antebellum America. Yet that version of the 'Democratic Party' virtually disappeared after the Civil War.  Clearly the new Republican Party offered something so appealing to Northern voters and so appalling to the South that succession and war were logical outcomes. Let's talk about the antebellum Democrats, Whigs and Republicans.  Of course, Lincoln will be the star of the show with a special guest appearance by the Locofocos. I have a few questions.

If Lincoln had won the election but somehow avoided war would he have been able to change direction of the country as much as he did?  Could he have been a great President if rather than war we had had gridlock?

Are there parallels to today when we may be going through another period of party realignment?

We're headed back to Citicorp Center.  But if anyone can scout out a better place, let the group know.  See you then.
results.name: Lincoln Republicans - Then and Now

results.description:
Dear New York Area Life Science Professionals,

Please join us for the group’s first meet-up of 2016.  This will be a fairly informal networking event with plenty of room to meet with your colleagues in the Life Science community.  And feel free to bring your friends in the Life Science community.

To get the discussion started, we have proposed a topic important to everyone in the healthcare marketplace – how will healthcare look five or ten years down the line as the population faces age-related diseases.  Baby boomers started turning 65 in 2011 and the U.S. Census Bureau estimates that by 2050 the U.S population over 65 will nearly double to over 83 million.  There will be challenges and opportunities in healthcare as a result.

The members of this meet-up is group represents a wide range of expertise  It would be great to hear from biochemists working on drugs to treat dementia, venture capitalists looking for the next advance to manage diabetes, programmers developing telemedicine applications, big data researchers tackling healthcare cost models, and others in this vibrant professional community that can share their perspective on how we will meet these challenges. 

We will get started around 6:30.  You will have a chance to talk with your fellow professionals  and enjoy wine, beer, and light appetizers.  At some point (depending on the mood of the crowd) we will break the room into teams for a round of Life Science Jeopardy.

The event will be at my office at 745 Fifth Avenue, on 5th between 57th and 58th.  The entrance is on the 10th floor.  Please RSVP so we have an idea of the size of the crowd.

I hope to see all of you here on the 16th. 

Best regards,

Steve Lieb
results.how_to_find_us: Frommer Lawrence & Haug LLP, 745 Fifth Avenue (on 5th between 57th and 58th), 10th Floor
results.name: Networking and Discussion: The Healthcare Marketplace as the Population Ages

results.description:
Rise New York will be hosting their very first Rising Tides event, a new series of intimate, interactive conversations with successful startup founders, who will share their personal stories and successes when establishing their startups while answering any questions you might have. This entertaining discussion will offer practical advice that will propel you and your business forward.

Speakers include Jane Barratt [Founder + CEO at GoldBean], Alex Abelin [Co-Founder + CEO of LiquidTalent], and Diane Hessan [CEO, StartupInstitute].

Please RSVP on the Rising Tides page too.

About Liquid Talent: LiquidTalent has built a marketplace that connects technical talent, both web developers and designers with fast-growing, mission-driven companies that are making a difference in the world. Through their web and mobile platform and focus on building an exceptional community, they are creating the future of work platform for the next generation economy. They have amazing companies such as Warby Parker, IBM/Watson, Justworks, Daybreaker, WeWork, StationHead, CharityMiles and many, more who are looking for exceptional talent. You can either message or request a call with an employer within minutes after your application is accepted. If you are a web developer or designer, apply to their community here >> https://goo.gl/FuOTrN

About Byte Academy :Byte Academy offers intensive full and part-time courses that emphasize full-stack programming using Python and industry-oriented programs such as FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech.  Byte Academy is the first coding bootcamp in the world to offer a Financial Technology (FinTech) program and the first in New York City to teach full stack Python. Small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events are included in the program.  Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 scholarships. Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for all courses which start every 4 weeks.

Byte Academy was just nominated for the Benzinga FinTech Awards, please vote here to show support http://bit.ly/1Ljq2DJ 

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco(twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
Andrew Jackson's Democratic Party dominated antebellum America. Yet that version of the 'Democratic Party' virtually disappeared after the Civil War.  Clearly the new Republican Party offered something so appealing to Northern voters and so appalling to the South that succession and war were logical outcomes. Let's talk about the antebellum Democrats, Whigs and Republicans.  Of course, Lincoln will be the star of the show with a special guest appearance by the Locofocos. I have a few questions.

Were the Whigs the equivalent of the go-along get-along pre-Reagan Republicans? 

Given the Madisonian Constitution, was there a any conceivable political solution to the crises of the 1850's?


If Lincoln had won the election but somehow avoided war would he have been able to change direction of the country as much as he did?  

Could he have been a great President if rather than war we had had gridlock?

Are there parallels to today when we may be going through another period of party realignment?

We're headed back to Citicorp Center.  But if anyone can scout out a better place, let the group know.  Look for my little American Flag.  See you then.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll try to grab the large table right in front of the wall hanging
results.name: Lincoln Republicans - Then and Now

Join fellow technologists, entrepreneurs, and investors for the NY Enterprise Technology Meetup's (NYETM) March meetup on Wednesday 3/16/16 from 6:30pm-9:00pm!

For our March meetup we have a panel discussion and two exciting companies demoing their technologies: 

Panel:

"How to Hire Top Talent for your Enterprise Tech Startup"

• Emily Disston, Director of HR at BetterCloud 

• Chintan Vora, Sr. Talent Acquisition Manager, Product & Engineering at Percolate 


• Ryan Elberg, Talent Acquisition Lead at Datadog 

• Lauren Ryan, Director of Talent Acquisition at Greenhouse

• Moderator: Stephanie Manning, Community & Talent at Work-Bench


Demos:

• Synthesio - Synthesio is a global Social Intelligence platform used by large enterprises, brands, and agencies to analyze conversations on social media. Using Synthesio, organizations can sift through the ocean of social data to classify trends, identify influencers, and benchmark business performance.  Synthesio was named a Leader in both Forrester Wave Reports on the Social Listening industry that was released Q1 2016.


• Alloy - Alloy is an API to collect and manage customer data from many different sources. We help companies in financial services or other regulated industries safely onboard more “good" customers without introducing any more fraud into their systems. We connect many data sources used for identity verification into a rules engine, which is proven to increase the number of customers you can safely accept by 10-20% depending on the industry.

Sign up today, and if you have any questions, please contact Jon Lehr at [masked]. 


Looking forward to seeing you all soon!

Yours in collaboration,

results.description:
Gleb Bahmutov and Nolan Lawson will talk about ServiceWorkers and WebWorkers.

Gleb Bahmutov (@bahmutov) is JavaScript ninja, image processing expert and software quality fanatic. After receiving a PhD in computer science from Purdue University, Gleb worked on laser scanners, 3D reconstruction, and panorama-based virtual tours at EveryScape. Later Gleb switched to writing browser data visualization software at MathWorks. After a year, Gleb went back to the startup environment and developed software quality analysis tools at uTest (now Applause). Today Gleb is developing real-time financial analysis tools at Kensho.

WebWorkers have been very useful for performing computation-intensive tasks in parallel, preventing browser lockup. Recently a new beast has appeared: the ServiceWorker. Most examples show this technology used to provide powerful offline and caching. Gleb will show how to use ServiceWorker to implement what used to be impossible

• Make any web application appear instantly in the browser

• Run the most popular Nodejs server ExpressJS completely inside your browser

Nolan Lawson (@nolanlawson) is a dual Android/web developer at Squarespace, and co-maintainer of PouchDB. He's passionate about offline, performance, and pushing the boundaries of the mobile web.


"You have nothing to lose but your single-threaded environment"

• Web workers: surprisingly powerful, tragically underused

• Perf and framerate benefits (with data!)

• Polyfilling for naughty browsers

• Future: WebGL, Canvas2D, and other marvels browser vendors are cooking up

Spotify is hosting us again. And they still have food and beer!

As always, we are going to have "geekaways" with geeky prizes!

Agenda:

6:30 - Arrive at Spotify, meet other members
6:45 - Event starts
7:00 - Taking advantage of ServiceWorker and WebWorkers for faster boot up times (Gleb Bahmutov & Nolan Lawson)
8:00 - Q&A
8:15 - "Books and Stuff" geekaways
8:30 - Open Discussion, Networking

Location:

Spotify
45 West 18th St
7th floor
New York, NY

Directions on Google Maps: http://bit.ly/1Jx2bUA

Entrance on StreetView: http://bit.ly/1Jc5g6P

Our Sponsors:

• Akamai® is the leading cloud platform for helping enterprises provide secure, high-performing user experiences on any device, anywhere.

• New Relic is a software analytics company that makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications in real time.


• SOASTA’s web and mobile app test automation solution enables developers, QA professionals, and IT Operations teams to test with unprecedented speed, scale and precision.
