results.description:
A monthly opportunity to meet local small business owners,  mastermind, network, exchange ideas and improve your business.


Each month dynamic speakers share their latest insights to take your business to  the next level in the new economy.

You don't want to miss this event!


Date: Thursday, March 17, 2016

Time: 8:00 am - 9:15 am 

Place: The Middletown Pancake House, 1610 Route 35 South, Middletown NJ (next to Sears) 
Fee: $10 (includes breakfast)


If you have any questions, feel free to call Nicolena at my office at <a>[masked] or email her at [masked]. </a>
results.name: Business Breakthroughs Breakfast!

results.description:
Every 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday from 8-9:30AM we conduct our networking and business development meetings for salespeople, consultants, entrepreneurs and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) We are much more than your average networking group. We act as your own private business advisory council. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

Schedule for 2016 
Bfast @AXA: 8-9:30AM 
Happy Hour @Ainsworth Park 6-9:30 

January 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28 
February 11, 18 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 25 
March 10, 17 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 24 
April 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28 
May 12, 19 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 26 
June 9, 16 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 23 
July 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28 
August 11, 18 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 25 
September 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22 
October 13, 20 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 27 
November 10, 17 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 24 
December 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22 

What is a breakfast business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out... AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.) 4th floor (Always check with security) 

Please email or call Raphi Salem if you are interested in joining. We charge $20.00 for all meetings unless you become a member at $500/year. Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) If you are interested in joining, please RSVP here. Please contact Raphi Salem at [masked] or call[masked] if you have any questions.

We are part of 6 other meetup groups. Please check them out and join: 
http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Serious-Entrepreneurs-Only-Present-Get-Funded/ 
http://www.meetup.com/Entrepreneurs-NYC-Finance-Tech-Mktg-Sales-Expert-Advice/ 
http://www.meetup.com/Breakfast-Networking-USA/ 
http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Small-Business-Owners-Consultants-Salespeople/ 
http://www.meetup.com/Lunch-And-Focused-Networking/ 

We are also part of linked in. Please connect with me and join our groups: 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/websitemarketing 
https://www.linkedin.com/grp/home?gid=2142515 
https://www.linkedin.com/grp/home?gid=2792115 

Thank you. I look forward to meeting you in person soon.

Raphi Salem 
SalemGlobal Internet, Website Marketing and Lead Generation 
www.SalemGlobal.com 
www.RaphiSalem.com

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
NYC's 255th  Annual Saint Patrick's Day Parade will commemorate the 100th Anniversary of the 1916 Easter Rising.

Every March 17th, The Parade marches up from 44th St. along  Fifth Avenue to 79th Street and there the Parade finishes at around 4:30 - 5:00 pm.  It is usually televised on NBC Channel 4 in NYC. 

This year's Grand Marshall is  Senator George Mitchell who was instrumental in creating the Good Friday Agreement of 1998. 

The annual parade up Fifth Avenue to honor the Patron Saint of Ireland is a New York tradition that dates as far back as March 17, 1762 - 16 years before the Declaration of Independence was adopted. The original line of march went from City Hall to 125th St. in Harlem.The best viewing spots are toward the north end of the parade route, away from the shopping and work-a-day crowds that throng the sidewalks below 59th Street.

The New York Convention & Visitors Bureau says that the St. Patrick's Day Parade is the largest and most famous of the many parades held in the city each year.

The official website of the parade is: <a>ww.nycstpatricksparade.org.</a>  

Here you can find the history of the Parade along with the complete Line of March, Photo Gallery and more.

results.description:
How to Control Mood in Your Images with Color

As visual storytellers, we have many ways to shape the emotions of our viewer.
Using the color of light is a powerful tool by which to do this.

Lens choice and composition, as well as size and style of your light source, are some of the most common choices we make when setting up our scene. While the color of our lights, which is just as important, is often overlooked.  Join Daniel Norton OnSet and explore the use of lighting gels to add both subtle and extreme color to your images.

In this live hands-on demo we will shoot the same scene three times, each changing the color of our lights and the way the actor reacts. We will keep the same general lighting scheme, blocking for the actors and camera angles.

Learn how to use color to add depth and emotion
Learn how color can help define the character of your subject and the space they occupy
Learn the most useful gels to keep in your kit.

Demos Start at 12pm, 2pm and 4PM.
Each session will use different gels to create a change in emotional feel.
Come for one, come for all!

 Here's a wrap up video from when we did a similar demo in 2014 

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director of Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: FREE DEMO! OnSet: Using Color to Control Mood in Photo and Video

results.description:
We would like to invite you to our Customer Homework Challenge.


Third Thursday, every month, 12:30pm - 2:00pm.

Next in store Challenge Meeting is: March 17, 2016


We will give a you subject to shoot, and once a month we will to get together in our classroom. A different ‘assignment’ will be given each time.

We will compare ideas, share techniques and maybe have a little pizza!!!

Images should be emailed to us anytime up to 24 hours before meeting, and we will all view them together. ( [masked] )

Each week the group will vote a group ‘fav', and that photographer will have their photo up on our new website, with honorable mention.

Next Assignment:

• Please shoot a new image showing circles, arches or curves , and let’s compare.
There is so much to learn looking at each other’s work, and exchanging creative ideas and techniques.

• cir·cle

ˈsərk(ə)l/noun1. a round plane figure whose boundary (the circumference) consists of points equidistant from a fixed point (the center).</a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+band&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIITAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+circlet&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIIzAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+annulus&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIJjAA">2. a group of people with shared professions, interests, or acquaintances."she did not normally move in such exalted circles"synonyms:group, set, company, coterie, clique; More</a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+band&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIMTAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+bunch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIMzAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+sphere&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoINTAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+milieu&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoINzAA"></a>verb1. move all the way around (someone or something), especially more than once."the two dogs circle each other with hackles raised"synonyms:<a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=define+wheel&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiytN-YnYLLAhUJHD4KHYI0AfMQ_SoIOjAA">wheel, move around, revolve, rotate, whirl, spiral

• arch

[ahrch] 

noun1.Architecture.a curved masonry construction for spanning an opening, consistingof a number of wedgelike stones, bricks, or the like, set with thenarrower side toward the opening in such a way that forces on thearch are transmitted as vertical or oblique stresses on either side ofthe opening.an upwardly curved construction, as of steel or timber functioningin the manner of a masonry arch.a doorway, gateway, etc., having a curved head; an archway. the curved head of an opening, as a doorway.2.any overhead curvature resembling an arch.3.something bowed or curved; any bowlike part:the arch of the foot.

• curve

kərv/nounplural noun: curves1. a line or outline that gradually deviates from being straight for some or all of its length."the parapet wall sweeps down in a bold curve"</a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+turn&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQ_SoIIDAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+curl&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQ_SoIIjAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+hook&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQ_SoIJDAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+arch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQ_SoIJzAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+curvature&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQ_SoIKTAA"></a><a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&biw=1891&bih=787&q=define+curveball&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwih-MLWnYLLAhWEtRoKHXV9AwgQgCsILzAA">verb3rd person present: curves1. form or cause to form a curve."her mouth curved in a smile"synonyms:bend, turn, loop, wind, meander, undulate, snake, spiral, twist, coil, curl;

results.description:
1) FileMaker playing nice with others…

One of the most powerful and productive things that you can do with the FileMaker platform is integrate it with other technologies.

Here is just one example…lets say you have a solution that runs on the Desktop, both OS X and Windows (might also be running on iOS mobile devices and/or browsers…that’s a story for another day)

Some of the tasks that you are doing using FileMaker might have parts that are done in other applications, for example browsers, email clients, text editors, etc.

For these use cases, there is often a good return on investment to be gained from integrating FileMaker with other application(s).

Tony White of Tony White Designs, Inc. will share some (easy to deploy) techniques for integrating FileMaker with other applications…both from a dashboard and also within specific workflows.

2) FileMaker and QuickBooks…custom front end systems AND standardized accounting.

Gregory Durniak of File Shoppe will present on the basics of passing information between FileMaker and QuickBooks. Greg will share some tips and tricks as well as some things to look out for.

3) Open Mic. (depending on time)

group.name: New York FileMaker Pro Developers' Group

results.description:
FIRST Session:

The Integrated File System (IFS) is one of the most mid-understood parts of IBM i yet often contains highly confidential data.   This session will provide a description of the security model of the IFS, the dangers of the IFS and options for securing and remediating the issues.  Topics include IFS-specific authority settings, file shares, the NetServer and options for securing directories.

SECOND Session:

Rather than discussing specific features of IBM i security this session discusses some of the more quirky or odd features and outcomes of IBM i security settings.  Hear explanations of the QPWFSERVER authorization list, GID, primary group authority, QUSEADPTAUT system value, the authority checking algorithm and more.   This session is sure to make you say, ‘Ohhhhh, that’s how that works!’ .
results.how_to_find_us: WWW.NESTU.COM
results.name: Carol Woodbury - IFS Security and Quirky IBMi stuff

group.name: IBMi for Power Systems - Built for Business - NESTU -NJ

results.description:
Thursday evening, March 17, 2016

EVENING DETAILS:

6:00PM - Doors open, head to the Radio City room on the 6th floor.

6:15PM - Introduction by the host, housekeeping, sponsors,

6:30PM - Main presentation begins (see abstract below).

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list. Please keep your RSVP up-to-date should you find yourself unable to come.

MAIN PRESENTATION

Azure Machine Learning (by Shiva Chittamuru)

 Machine learning uses computers to run predictive models that learn from existing data in order to forecast future behaviors, outcomes, and trends that can make apps and devices smarter. Azure Machine Learning Studio is the place where data science, predictive analytics, cloud resources, and your data meet. This talk focuses on the overview of Machine Learning, what's in it for developers, and how Azure ML makes it easy to build accurate predictive models and make your apps smarter.

About Shiva Chittamuru:

Shiva Chittamuru is a Technical Evangelist here in Microsoft on the ISV team based out of NYC. His focus is on big data and data analytics. He has done his Master’s in University of Minnesota Duluth.  Hadoop and Natural Language Processing were part of his courses there. He enjoys working in data space.
results.name: Azure Machine Learning (Shiva Chittamuru )

results.description:
Larry Kirwan will return to BB King's on St. Patrick's Day, March 17th. He will front a band formed specially for the evening which will commemorate the 100th Anniversary of the 1916 Uprising. They will be joined onstage by Chris Byrne and many surprise guests and will perform new material, along with many of Kirwan's Black 47 classics, and songs from his critically acclaimed musicals.  The band will be based around  Coty Cockrell (Hard Times/Dance Theatre of Harlem) on piano, Deni Bonet (Cyndi Lauper/Sarah McLachlan) on violin, Rene Hart (Branford Marsalis/Mark Ronson on double bass, Thomas Hamlin (Black 47) on drums. 

Chris Byrne's band, The Lost Tribe of Donegal, will perform a set of their Urban/Traditional Irish songs and tunes. Kirwan's son, Rory K, will also hit the stage with Kirwan, after performing a short set of his high-energy, youthful anthems. He will be releasing his second CD, Young Professionals, at the show. 


Long time yellow cab driver, and stand up comedian, John McDonagh will perform a short excerpt from his acclaimed show, Cabtivist. Host of Radio Free Eireann and Talk Back on WBAI-FM, McDonagh will MC the festivities. 

This is an All Ages show designed to keep the party going after the St. Patrick's Day Parade. 


TICKETS NOW ON SALE: 

http://www.bbkingblues.com/bio.php?id=6507

Celebrate St. Patrick's Day at B.B. Kings with Larry Kirwan & Friends 

March 17, 2016

Showtime @ 7pm /Doors Open @ 6pm

Ticket Pricing:

*VIP Reserved Center Balcony Seating  $65 

* General Admission - Standing Room 

* $25 Advance / $30 Day of Show

 Limited Seating Available on a First Come, First Served  Basis 

Full Menu Available /* $10 Minimum Per Person, For All Tables 

Seating & Club Policy
Packages & Discounts For Large Groups of 10 Or More (Subject to Availability)

- Further information at:

http://www.bbkingblues.com

results.description:
Hello Everyone!  

Saint Patrick's Day is fast approaching so let's celebrate! Join us for a special Saint Paddy's Day dance party @ 230 Fifth!

*DATE: Thursday, March 17th from 6-11PM 

*DRINK SPECIALS: 

*$6 draft beer!

*$7 red & white wine!

*$8 well drinks!

*FOOD SPECIALS:

Fish & chips!

It will feature:

*Dancing to all your favorite tunes with DJ Baby D, formerly of Culture Club!

***FREE ADMISSION!***

*Location: 230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Since 230 FIFTH's opening in May of 2006:

* Voted #1 by the Editors of CitySearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City

* Voted #2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by CitySearch


* Voted #1 thing "To Do" in New York by Spur, Japan's leading fashion magazine


The enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The supersized and luxurious enclosed Penthouse Lounge is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline.

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden is a hot-spot in the summer and a not-to-be-missed winter experience with its heated outdoor Rooftop Garden and legendary hooded red fleece robes which are given to guests upon their arrival.


The Food at 230 FIFTH

Besides offering a full bar, 230 FIFTH also offers a full kitchen menu (serving food from 4:00PM - 3:00AM), which was created by renowned chef Zak Pelaccio who has been featured numerous times in The New York Times Dining Out section.

See you there!

Andy

results.description:
Empowering Ethical Elders  is pleased to have M. Victoria Kopke, MD, Assistant Professor of Medicine at Mt. Sinai speak on this topic. 


 The presentation will be given at 2 West 64th Street in Manhattan,.That's the historic  NY Society for Ethical Culture.  We urge you to register by calling [masked] and simply leave a message with your name and phone #.


As usual, there'll be time for questions. There'll be a table with beverages and light fare. And..., it's FREE.

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosxual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at  BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month (starting in 2016, every 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday evening) at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
For our March meetup, Russell Wolf from Philosophie will lead a presentation about Real-Time Application Architecture with Ionic and AngularJS.

Philosophie helps companies design and build better software by focusing on the users and humanizing the process. They work primarily on new web and mobile products. Their clients range from early-stage startups to multi-national enterprises who want to bring lean startup tactics to their projects.

Russell build awesome digital products for fun and profit. He has been a software engineer at Philosophie for two years, and have worked with Ionic for a little over a year.

This event is sponsored by Philosophie and hosted by Axial.

We will have a few lightning talks preceding Russell's presentation so feel free to reach out to Raquel or Xavier if you would like to present!

We are looking forward to see you all!

results.description:
Thursday March 17 from 6-8pm
Otake is one of the leading young Nihonga artists in Japan. A common theme Otake uses in her works are butterflies and flowers. Butterflies here means “Psyche” from the Greek, life in the sense of “breath”, “spirit”, and “soul” and ultimately “ego” in the sense of conscious personality. She paints butterflies in her works representing these symbols: soul, mind, “Numen”(the power of God), but also beauty, shimmer, and spiritual renaissance.

Japanese Painting (Nihonga) is a term created during the Meiji Period to differentiate traditional Japanese painting from Western-style paintings. Using expensive minerals and metallic pigments, traditional painters chose bold images in nature and frequently referred to Japanese court literature and poetry.
Today, the term Nihonga refers not to a particular style alone, but it is used in a broader sense to refer to various types of paintings with Indian ink or mineral pigments mixed with animal glue on a support such as silk or Japanese paper.

Otake’s canvas is not only paper or folding screens. She painted cherry blossoms and butterflies in the guest room in Park Hotel in Tokyo. Her beautiful motifs express infinite passage in time, and uncertainty and fact that we remain the same while the world around us changes incessantly.

Hiroko Otake was born in Japan and is currently working on her new pieces in New York given a grant by Agency for Cultural Affairs Government of Japan.
She graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts with a BA in :Japanese Painting, and later received her PhD in Fine Art. She has been exhibiting her art extensively in various places such as Megumi Ogita Gallery in Tokyo Japan, Seibu Ikebukuro Art Gallery in Tokyo, Japan, IAM Gallery New York, USA, and AMBIT Gallery Barcelona, Spain. She has also had group exhibitions at various Art Shows such as Art Fair Tokyo, Art Nagoya, and New City Art Fair Taipei

results.description:
Hi All

THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with

1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I'm the one holding a cup of wine not a baton.

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

Mark Hagen, Edie Fake, Andre Razo and David Aron

March 17
Personal Reflections on Wondrous Worlds: Sister Frederica Bey
Sister Fredrica Bey is one of the founders of Women In Support of the Million Man March, Inc. (WISOMMM, Inc.) and an active voice for social justice in the community
6-6:45 pm

Images and Realities Films:Material directed by Craig Freimond
7 pm

Special guest: Tauriq Jenkins, an actor in theater, film and TV who trained at the Columbia University School of the Arts is founding Director of the Independent Theater Movement of South Africa.

A hilarious comedy set in the Muslim Indian enclave of Johannesburg, South Africa, Material revolves around the tempestuous relationship between Cassin Kaif, an aspiring comedian and his aging father whose one dream is to see his son take over the family business. The film’s portrayal of the clash between youth, tradition, and religion alternates between heart-wrenching family drama and hilarious snippets from the world of stand-up comedy. 2012, 94 minutes

“Material is one of the smartest, most heartwarming movies to originate from South Africa” – Stephen Aspeling, SPL!NG

For information on future films in this series please click on the dates below.

- See more at: http://www.newarkmuseum.org/islamic-film-series-march-17#sthash.PGoo9wLF.dpuf

results.description:
Hello Everyone! Click here to buy your tickets. Seats are limited.

http://threesecretstolivinganabundantlife.eventbrite.com

**********************************************************

Did you start the New Year excited about living your best year yet, but soon find yourself holding on to the same old habits that prevent you from reaching your full potential?   


Have you been through a series of relationships…but none of them have worked?

Do you want to create meaningful and lasting relationships with friends and lovers?

Are you looking for a community that celebrates you exactly as you are?  

Have you simply given up on finding the ideal partner?

Do you wonder where all the good men are hiding?

Do you want to experience more joy and fulfillment in your life?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, this workshop was designed with YOU in mind, and it contains the exact information, guidance, and insights you need to create the incredible life and relationship you’ve always wanted and deserve! 

Participants will learn: 

- How to cultivate an internal dialogue that is positive and compassionate

- Why it's important for us to be authentic and share our stories as gay men

- The power of living a life from the inside out ... intrinsically

- What we are all here to learn, become, teach and give back to our community

- How to maximize their impact in the gay community and beyond


After the workshop, participants will leave inspired to:

- Create a practice of daily rituals that will make them feel alive

- Own their story to set them free to create more meaningful relationships

- Live life by design from the inside out.

As gay men, our life's purpose is to teach others the art of unconditional love, and that starts when we love ourselves completely.  By owning our story, we help others see their own humanness in ourselves. From there, we can create passionate and meaningful relationships and live the abundant life we always visualized in our dreams.  

During the workshop, we will have an interactive dialogue on how to transform our negative thoughts into positive thoughts, allowing us to step into our greatness.  We will talk about the importance of sharing and embracing our stories, so that we can start creating the ending we all want.  We will talk about the benefits of living a life from the inside out ... being intrisnically motivated.  

We will create a place where everyone feels safe to share ... so we can experience the beauty of seeing our authentic selves in each another. We will talk about the importance of being part of a tribe that provides the necessary support and encouragement so we can live an abundant life.
results.name: Three Secrets To Living An Abundant Life

results.description:
It is very easy to write programs for Android smart phones and tablets using a modern version of BASIC called Mintoris BASIC. In this class you will learn how to obtain the Mintoris BASIC app and view some demos.  Participants will recieve a printable version of the 80-page manual, create a user interface, read sensors from the Android device like the GPS, accelerometer, light meter, and send the values to a laptop computer via bluetooth. You will also learn how to send commands to and from a bluetooth-equipped arduino. 

What to bring: An Android device with WiFi and Bluetooth. (NOT an iPhone or iPad).  You will need to download the app from the google play store which is available as a free version which allows you to view the demos or a paid ($7) version which allows you to write code.  Participants 

Cost: $25

Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member.


To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.
results.name: Graybar Toastmaster meeting!

Topic: Monitoring Docker ContainersSpeaker: Matt Williams, DevOps Evangelist, DataDog

If you have tried Docker but are unsure about how to monitor it at scale,you will benefit from this session.Like virtualization before, containerization (a la Docker) is increasing the elastic nature of cloud infrastructureby orders of magnitude. But maybe you still have questions?This session will address those questionsand/or provide you with a method to answer them yourselves.

Datadog is a monitoring service for IT, operations, and development teams,who write and run applications at scale.In this session, Datadog's Evangelist will present the challenges and benefits of running containers at scale,and how to monitor your infrastructure at this magnitude and complexity using quantitative performance patterns.

results.description:
Please join us as our host and speaker Obiamaka ("Obi") P. Madubuko, shareholder at Greenberg Traurig, takes us through the risks and pitfalls associated with Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) compliance and the international anti-bribery and anti-corruption law landscape.

In today’s increasingly competitive economic climate, international anti-bribery and anti-corruption law compliance is of critical importance to businesses. Global enforcement of the FCPA and other international anti-corruption laws remains strong, with record-breaking fines and penalties being levied against corporations and lengthy prison sentences for individual offenders.  Given the current environment, companies need to be able to effectively manage and minimize corruption risks when doing business internationally. This CLE will provide practical guidance to corporate counsel on FCPA requirements, recent enforcement trends and, most importantly, how their organizations can maintain effective compliance programs to minimize their FCPA risks. This program will also feature an interactive discussion of the following:

·  How do anti-corruption compliance programs vary? What do the SEC and DOJ expect?

·  How do you measure the effectiveness of your anti-corruption compliance program?  

·  What about resources – how much staff/ technology/ management buy-in do you need?

·  Where are the FCPA “hot spots”?

·  What are some key corruption risk drivers (geography, industry, third parties, customer)?

·  What checks and balances are needed to control for and minimize corruption risks?

·  How to incorporate new employees, third party agents and strategic business partners into your compliance culture, especially for those located outside the home country?

·  How to perform adequate due diligence on third parties? How much diligence is enough?

·  How to incentivize compliance?

The presentation will be given from 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM. 

This program is pending approval for 1.5 NY & NJ General Practice CLE credit.

A networking cocktail reception will follow the presentation!
results.name: CLE  | The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act – What You Don’t Know Can Hurt You.

results.description:
In advance of World Water Day, March 22, and at the height of the 60th Commission on the Status of Women, the United Nations Southern New York Young Professionals (UNA-SNY Young Professionals) in conjunction with Alpha Kappa Alpha (Tau Omega Chapter) are hosting an event on the role of women addressing water crises in the United States and abroad.

Last year, United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon highlighted, "Water is life. Water is health. Water is dignity. Water is a human right," at the culmination event of the Water for Life Decade. With the adoption of the Sustainable Development Goals, the interconnectedness between achieving gender equality and empowering all women and girls (SDG 5) and ensuring availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all (SDG 6) is clear. Women and girls have been and continue to be disproportionately affected by water crises around the world.

Some of these crises range from lack of safe drinking water and sanitation to water privatization and more. Despite this, women have taken a key role in addressing these crises as they are important stakeholders in improving water and sanitation management in their communities.

This event aims to highlight the role women have taken to address water issues in the United States and abroad.

SPEAKERS INCLUDE:

THE HONORABLE ALICE M. DEAR, ALPHA KAPPA ALPHA’S NGO REPRESENTATIVE TO ECOSOC

LESHA WITMER, CHAIR OF THE STANDING COMMITTEE ON ENVIRONMENT, SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT

MARIET VERHOEF-COHEN, PRESIDENT OF WOMEN FOR WATER PARTNERSHIP

REMARKS BY:
MELISSA MAYS, FLINT RESIDENT AND FOUNDER OF WATERYOUFIGHTINGFOR

E-mail UNA-SNY YP Social and Humanitarian Affairs Committee Director Marielle Ali at [masked] to RSVP. You MUST RSVP to attend as only limited space is available.

https://www.facebook.com/events/945510112170723/
results.name: Women’s Responses to Water Crises in the U.S. and Abroad

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
To all members who RSVP:

As a organizer, I strongly encourage members to speak the language you want to learn to your counterpart. Although this meetup begins at 6:30, you are very welcome to join us even after 6:30. 

To English learners: 

You are very welcome to attend the meetup to practice English.

To Mandarin learners: 

You need to make sure the organizer knows your E-mail address after you RSVP because I will send you learning materials.(If you don't want to show your E-mail address on your profile, please send me your E-mail address and tell me your user name on the RSVP list after you RSVP. My E-mail address is: [masked]

The learning materials include an article with English and Mandarin translation and records of English and Mandarin that can teach you how to pronounce correctly. 

If you want to discuss the article, I encourage you preview and listen these learning materials prior to attending the meetup so that we can go through it quickly and then have a free talk. Also, you can just ignore the learning materials and only come here to have a free talk. Reading learning material is not an obligation.
results.how_to_find_us: The pret a manger is just nearby the 28th street subway station of 6 train
results.name: Let's learn Mandarin and English and have a conversation!

group.name: New York Learning English and Mandarin Meetup

results.description:
The March of Joomla, learn about new features coming up in Joomla and how to better use it.

We start promptly at 6:30 with Networking and Pizza, followed our presentation. lastly is our raffle for a free Jetbrains product.

We ask for a $10 contribution to defray costs.

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Brian S. Cohen (NY Angels)

As a professional angel investor and mentor to entrepreneurs, Brian serves as Chairman of the New York Angels, the #1 most active angel group in the country, with more than $100M invested into more that 100 early stage companies. Brian was the first investor in Pinterest, and numerous other industry leading startups. Brian is the Founding Manager of New York Venture Partners LLC, a seed stage venture capital firm dedicated to providing an ecosystem of financing, mentorship, and strategic marketing consulting to the best entrepreneurs.

Agenda

6:30 pm Networking

7:00 pm Fireside Chat

8:00 pm Meet The Community

Hosted By Peter Crysdale, New York City Director

Peter is the Founder/CEO of StrategyHack, running marketing strategy hackathons for startups and professional marketers. He has a diverse background with 8+ years experience spanning engineering, social good and technology startups. In his spare time, he enjoys day dreaming and cross country skiing.


Twitter: @PCrysdale Hosted By Joshua Ness, New York City Co-Director

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.


Twitter: @jcness Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Local Sponsors

Telx, Digital Realty’s (NYSE:DLR) Colocation and Connectivity line of business, fuels infrastructure, interconnection and business progress. With industry-leading 100% uptime and 100% on-time service delivery SLAs, Telx helps companies build more agile businesses faster with reduced infrastructure complexity and broader reach to new markets. Telx colocation and connectivity products serve a broad range of industries from network dense Internet/Cloud Gateway data centers located across 13 US markets: Atlanta, Charlotte (NC), Chicago, Dallas, Los Angeles, Miami, New Jersey, New York, Phoenix, Portland, San Francisco, Santa Clara, and Seattle. With more than 50,000 network connections, Telx enables the hybrid cloud strategies of our customers, and the interconnection of more than 10 million square feet of data center space around the world.

Justworks frees entrepreneurs to focus on their business and their team. Its simple platform automates HR, payments, benefits, and government paperwork while saving companies up to 30% on healthcare. Headquartered in New York City, Justworks is funded by Bain Capital Ventures, Thrive Capital and Index Ventures. Learn more at Justworks.com.

Fiverr is the world’s largest marketplace for creative and professional services, providing any digital service in one click. Whether designing a fresh website, writing colorful advertising copy or recording a catchy jingle, Fiverr Sellers deliver high-quality services in more than 150 categories.

The Devon Group designs and delivers measurable PR and marketing programs that enable organizations to build credibility for products, services and ventures, generate qualified sales leads, and stake claims to new markets. Find out what the Devon difference can do for your company.

Our services and offerings are crafted to help your organization polish your message, reach existing audiences while finding new ones, get your messaging to resonate with customers, media, and analysts, and reach beyond your goals.

After 20+ years in business, The Devon Group knows a thing or two about finding your voice and maximizing the potential of your message. Contact our team of senior practitioners today to find out what services we have to offer your organization.

Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

Partner

The Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars, is a unique programme designed to take your business further. It’s fintech-focused and over-flowing with opportunities.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 170 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

results.description:
Overview:

Asset returns based on low frequency prices (e.g. end-of-day quotes) are still dominating modern portfolio analysis. To make portfolio metrics more relevant intraday and improve precision of estimates, new data frequency needs to be explored. In this presentation we demonstrate how using high frequency market data for portfolio risk management and optimization could improve the classic variance-bias trade-off and bring new insights to strategy backtesting. We illustrate our examples using PortfolioEffectHFT package for R statistical software. Since high frequency prices require special handling, we discuss key components of a model pipeline for microstruture noise, price jumps, outliers, fat tails and long-memory. We conclude our presentation with an introduction to high frequency portfolio optimization built on top of intraday portfolio metrics.

Come and enjoy food and drinks!. Presentation starts at 7:00 pm.

About Speaker:


Stephanie is a director of portfolio analytics at PortfolioEffect. Stephanie spent 8 years as a quantitative developer at Karya Capital, UBS and Societe Generale and was a senior risk analyst at MF Global. She has extensive experience in interest rate derivatives and quantitative library development. She holds a Master’s degree in Mathematics of Finance from Columbia University and a Master’s in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science from ENSIMAG, France.
results.name: High Frequency Portfolio Backtesting with PortfolioEﬀectHFT Package for R

results.description:
DESCRIPTION: This monthly meetup covers algorithms. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills : You'll solve algorithms in small groups, breaking off into your preferred programming language and working together to find a solution. Problems are provided and vary in difficulty, check out the Github for examples of past problems: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Beginners : You'll pair with other members and practice answering easier algo questions. This group will be led by a more experienced developer who will help you out when you get stuck.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment and a short intro talk
7:15 Meetup starts 
9:00 Event ends after solution presentation from volunteers

Resources: The WWCNYC Github contains questions (and solutions) from past events, as well as upcoming problems! Submit solutions, contribute interview questions and more: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Other resources: 

http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html
http://codingforinterviews.com/practice

Resources for beginners or anyone who needs to review:

http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/algorithms-and-data-structures--cms-20437
http://www.nczonline.net/blog/tag/algorithms/

For our beginners, we recommend creating accounts on either http://jsbin.com/ or http://codepen.io/, to give you an place to practice your algorithms problem-solving skills.

HOST: Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

WWCode events are intended for all women (trans and cis), trans men, and genderqueer folks who are interested in attending. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly and committed to matters of social justice as an organization. Select events may be open to the general public, which will be clearly noted in event descriptions. Our Code of Conduct is in effect at all of our events. If you have any questions, please message the Directors of this chapter.
results.name: Algorithms @ Betterment

Class Summary:

Do you want to take your marketing skills to the next level? Do you have an event/small business and want to send a customized newsletter to your friends/customers? Building an email newsletter is different than building a webpage but you use the same language in HTML and CSS. In this class, you’ll learn the fundamental techniques to build out a simple email newsletter in HTML and CSS (including testing and shipping) in under two hours!

Key Takeaways: 

· Learn how to build well laid-out email newsletter through the use of tags and tables
· Add an image to your email newsletter
· Learn about the workflow of creating email newsletters including shipping and testing newsletters
· Build an email newsletter in HTML/CSS by the end of class

Pre-reqs & Pre - work:

 · No pre-requisites
· Bring a computer
· Install Sublime Text 2 and please review the class outline before class.

results.description:
In an historic milestone for the Montclair Green Film Series, the office of Environmental Affairs and Community Green proudly present their 70th monthly environmental documentary on Thursday, March 17, 6:30p.m., at the Public Library, 50 So. Fullerton Avenue. All events at the Library are free.

All energy resources — fossil fuels, renewables, and nuclear — have been undergoing profound changes; overall, we are gradually shifting to the energies of tomorrow.

“Switch” explores this sweeping transition, but rather than simply advocate that it should happen, the filmmakers travel the world to discover how, when, and where this transformation is occurring. Filmed in 11 countries and exploring 9 key energy resources – from coal to solar, oil to biofuels – viewers take an exciting world tour of the energy frontier.

The film is also about the changing energy conversation: today it’s polarized and unproductive, but “Switch” focuses on practical realities, encouraging balance and understanding.

Finally, the movie is about changing the way we use energy, to realize the many economic and environmental benefits of simple and smart efficiency.

Please join us, and bring a friend, a family member, or your neighbor for this fascinating film screening, and an open public discussion afterwards.

For further questions, please contact Marnie Vyff at (973)[masked] or [masked]
results.name: 70th Montclair Environmental Movie Night: SWITCH

This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
In situations of conflict, we tend to become angry easily. We even think anger will help us ‘win’ our battles, and we rely on it as if it were our trusted friend. The mind of anger, however, leaves a trail of broken relationships, lost opportunities, and painful feelings in its wake. In this class, we will learn to use Buddha’s skillful techniques to remain balanced, flexible and peaceful in the midst of difficult circumstances, thereby overcoming our real enemy, the painful mind of anger itself. It is not enough to simple KNOW anger is a negative force in our lives, we need to see it for ourselves. It is only when we understand the dangers of anger that we actually develop the internal power to oppose and reduce its effects. In this series, we will learn to meditate on anger and patience, discovering how to transform a disturbed, turbulent mind into a peaceful attitude that will enable us to solve our conflicts and leave us feeling peaceful and focused.

The classes will include instruction, guided meditations and discussion. The mind-training methods taught in this course include meditation and meditation break exercises; these are tried-and-tested methods which can be practiced by anyone–regardless of prior experience.  Give yourself and your loved ones the gift of a patient mind
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org

results.description:
Abstract:

AI and machine learning have made important recent progress in areas such as object recognition and game playing, yet the best example of intelligence is still natural intelligence. Concept learning provides an illustrative window into the human-machine intelligence gap: People can learn a new concept from just one or a few examples, while the best learning algorithms require many more examples to reach the same level of performance. People also use their concepts in richer ways than conventional machine learning systems -- for imagination, extrapolation, and explanation -- not just for classification. I will discuss my work on program induction as a cognitive model and potential solution for extracting richer concepts from less data, with applications to learning handwritten characters and learning recursive programs from examples.

Speaker Bio:


Brenden Lake (http://cims.nyu.edu/~brenden/) is a cognitive scientist and Moore-Sloan Data Science Fellow at New York University. He studies computational problems that are easier for people than they are for machines, with the dual goals of better understanding people and developing a more human-like learning capacity in machines.
Brenden received his Ph.D. in Cognitive Science from MIT in 2014, and his thesis work was awarded the Robert J. Glushko Prize for Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations in Cognitive Science. He received a M.S. and B.S. in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University in 2009. He is also co-founder of Cognitive ToyBox, a New York City start-up.
results.name: Concept learning as program induction

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
As performers, we  tend to spend a good amount of our time leaning our craft and preparing ourselves for that big break. The conventional wisdom is that it takes a long time and a lot of effort.  And of course there is some truth to that.  We do have to learn the fundamentals of our craft, and practice till we have achieved a level of mastery. But even after mastery has been attained, we still find ourselves saying, "I'm not quite ready yet", or "If I could only learn that" or as Franz Joseph Hayden said on his death bed, after having composed over 100 symphonies, "I was only just learning how to compose." 


What if it is possible to achieve the results you are committed to producing, but much more quickly?  What if we could have it all now, rather than someday later?


I am ready to start a truly great band and I am committed to empowering a few people to unleash their creative energies in partnership with me.  I invite all of you who are willing to explore having it all now to join me for this Free event.


The is no cost for this evening and I promise you will have an access to a new level of creative expression.
results.name: Creativity Unleashed - A Breakthrough Event for Creative People

By using recycled plastic bags for the installations, the work allows the viewer a measure of intimacy through the familiarity of the material. In transforming these every day bags into delicate collages, I aim to reconsider the value of these once discarded objects and its impact on our natural environment.- Viviane Rombaldi Seppey


Join us for an evening of exploration, journey and enchantment with mixed-media collage!


Led by artist Viviane Rombaldi Seppey, we'll create mixed-media collage works inspired by her 2012 site specific installation "Kaleidoscope" realized from cut plastic bags and applied on the windows of then Mixed Greens Gallery.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

How many of you avoid Irish Pubs on St Patrick's Day because of the crowds and rowdiness?  Well, not to worry because we have rented out a private room at The St. Pat's Irish Pub in the heart of midtown where you can enjoy all the St Patrick's Day festivities without all the craziness!! It will be a fun way to socialize with others in the group, meet new people and enjoy great food and drink.  There will be a limited number of tickets sold to ensure that it will not be crowded.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at the door) Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/private-st-patricks-day-party-dinner-at-st-pats-irish-pub-tickets-21612785423

Here is what to expect:

-We have the private 3rd floor party room reserved for up to 50 members.

-There will be an all you can eat corned beef and cabbage buffet with potatoes and carrots available from 7-8:30pm

-St Paddy's Day Drink Specials

-Fun St Patrick's Day ice breaker games with prizes. 

-Fun traditional Irish Music all night 

Cost: $40 prepaid only includes private room rental for our members and all you can eat corned beef and cabbage dinner with carrots and potatoes.  (sorry there is no substitutions or discounts if you do not eat the buffet)

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at the door) Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/private-st-patricks-day-party-dinner-at-st-pats-irish-pub-tickets-21612785423

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

How crazy will it be? We will have fun for sure but the best part is that we can enjoy St. Paddy's and not worry about an overcrowded hot bar full of drunk idiots.

Is this a Dinner or Happy Hour?  It is a little of both.  Come and have a drink, then head to the buffet and enjoy a meal with others in the group, then either hang at your table or head back to the bar.  It is a totally casual atmosphere. Come anytime between 7-8:15 for the buffet but get there by 7:30 for the ice breaker games.

Dress code? Green anything of course!

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: Private St Patricks Day Party & Dinner at St. Pats Irish Pub Midtown

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.
results.name: Kirtan! Mantra Meditation

results.description:
What if we could shift the bulk of cancer drug research from chemists and cells to the computer? With the development of new drugs costing upwards of 1 billion dollars, Dr. Sonya Hanson from The John Chodera Lab at Memorial Sloan Kettering is tackling this issue by building computer programs to reduce the time and money it takes to get these drugs to market. 

Dr. Sonya Hanson is a postdoctoral fellow at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center researching targeted cancer treatments. Originally from Bloomington, Indiana, she got her B.S in Biophysics with a minor in Screenwriting at the University of Southern California. She received her Ph.D. at the University of Oxford as funded by the National Institutes of Health as part of the NIH-Oxford-Cambridge Scholars Program. She has been living in New York for two years. Sonya thinks science is cool and wants everyone else to think so too!
results.name: How Computer Programs Can Help Us Design Better Cancer Drugs

results.description:
So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
The plant medicines Ayahuasca, San Pedro and Iboga come from the jungles of Africa and South America, where for millennia they have been used by indigenous peoples guided by spirit. Today, that deep, intuitive knowledge is being verified by the latest neurophysiology — our scientific understanding of the human brain.


The shamanic wisdom of indigenous peoples who work with these sacred plants is also highly aligned with the mystical teachings found for instance in the Kabbalah or the Vedas.
In this talk, Fabian Michael Piorkowsky will describe a holistic approach to sacred plant medicine that brings together these indigenous lineages with the scientific worldview and kabbalistic, vedic and sufi mysticism — a unique, profound and informed perspective that supports the integration of shamanic practices in 21st century society.

$20 in advance
($25 at door)

Purchase tickets here: https://holisticplantmedicine.splashthat.com/
results.name: A Holistic, Integrated Approach to Sacred Plant Medicine with Fabian Piorkowsky

results.description:
It's time for the March session of NightShul!

NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. 

We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through March 17.

Offerings:


-Friendship or Death: Instructive Stories about Hevruta (study partnerships) in the Talmud taught by Rabbi Matt Carl

-Sex and The Rabbis taught by Rabbi Sara Zacharia

-On Beyond Zombies: Facing Death as Jews taught by Rabbi Regina Sandler-Phillips

SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SIGN UP. $15 FOR ONE NIGHT, $35 FOR MARCH SESSION, SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR FULL SEASON PRICING.
results.name: Let's create a community of adult Jewish learners-- March session

group.name: NightShul Learning Community at East Midwood Jewish Center

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]
