results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: New students first class is $15.00. NEW! Prepay and get a special monthly price of $150 for 3 classes per week. Or prepay $100 for 1 class/week for 1 month. We meet in the Martial Arts room to the right of the front desk.
results.name: Krav Maga Level One (NYSC)

group.name: Krav Maga Basics, Rape Defense- NYC Midtown (Kravmaguy)

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

results.description:
Come to The Espejo Organization for the Arts' first pop-up exhibition 


presenting Through A Window by Sahana Ramakrishnan at RABBITHOLESTUDIO
Thursday, March 17th, 2016
7.30 - 10.30 pm
Bring your loved ones!

In her first solo exhibition, Sahana Ramakrishnan offers an escape into a world in which human and animal bodies cease to exist as separates. The artist finds inspiration in the Hindu and Buddhist philosophies that stress our interconnectedness to other beings on this planet. In a language that is definably culturally ambiguous, she stitches together elements from contemporary and ancient fables from around the world, using man’s relationship with animals as a platform to examine human morality.


Through a Window features paintings and drawings rich with grotesque and surreal imagery that marry the freakish, the funny, and the beautiful. The artist uses found objects, decorative materials and calligraphic drawing to arrive at figural abstractions. Sahana creates a visual experience that portrays the drama and power struggles that arise when the boundaries between human and animal bodies are deconstructed.


Titled after anthropologist and ethologist Jane Goodall’s dramatic saga of chimpanzee life in the Gombe, Through a Window explores issues of human morality through the lense of the relationships we have with animals. The artist uses escapism to invite the viewer to reflect on the depth and nature of how we use animals in our contemporary mythology as extensions of ourselves.


Sahana Ramakrishnan was born in 1993 in Mumbai, India. She spent her childhood and early life in Singapore and travelled frequently within South East Asia, Europe, and Australia. She moved to the United States in 2011, and received her BFA in Painting from the Rhode Island School of Design in 2015. Sahana currently lives and works in Brooklyn, NY. Her work has been exhibited in New York galleries such as at A.I.R. Gallery, The Doping Agency, and Front Art Space.

Even though it has been a while since our last meetup, we hope you still want to hang out with us :)
results.name: Gallery Opening - Through a Window: Sahana Ramakrishnan at Rabbithole Projects

Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

results.description:
We have both attended and enjoyed Scientific Meetings which The Karen Horney Institute hosts.  Below this description is a link to The Karen Horney Institute if you would like to learn more.  We look forward to seeing you there.  Our BEST!

Presenter: Arlene Kramer Richards, Ed.D. & Lucille Spira, PhD, LCSW


Myths about women permeate the culture and impact female psychic development. The infinite variety of roles that attempt to define women have included: The Virgin Mother; Super Girl; Warrior Woman; Evil Temptress. This forum will examine particular myths from the classics, religious teachings, legends and popular culture that contribute to the identity and self‐esteem of women everywhere.


Societal pronouncements about who women are, and whom they might become, transmitted through the culture, impact the lives of all of us.  Psychoanalytic theory focused on the psychology of women will be highlighted. How women have adapted to, or, transcend stereotypes, will be part of the discussion.

http://www.karenhorneyclinic.org/about_page4.html


We accept a suggested $5 donation for Students and Professionals in Mental Health events, but no one is ever turned away.  We look forward to seeing you there.  Tyler and the Organizing Team

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Open House! Community Potluck & Hot Seats

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.

Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

results.description:
Writer-director Jack Hill (Spider Baby, Switchblade Sisters) managed to beat Death Wish to the screens by a year with this violent tale of a citizen touched by crime and deciding to fight back. Her little 11-year old sister is a hopeless addict, the police can't help, and poor Nurse "Coffy" Coffin (Pam Grier) has no choice but to take the law into her own hands. Posing as a Jamaican prostitute, Coffy infiltrates the lairs of pimp King George (Robert DoQui) and kingpin pusher Vitroni (Allan Arbus). Eventually, after her childhood sweetheart is beaten into a coma and she finds out her politician-lover (Booker Bradshaw) is involved, Coffy kills everyone with a shotgun. However, by having a black woman named Coffy get injected with a sugar mixture (the crooks think it's heroin), one can only imagine the filmmakers cackling about Coffy with cream and sugar. In fact, the original ad line promised "Coffy...she'll cream you!"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2jVAIitIP-4

results.description:
Please register for Apex&Geode Integration; Ingestion: Kafka to Hadoop/Apex & Geode on Mar 17,[masked]:00 PM EST at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/2693001217463037700

9:00pm - Webinar will start count down

9:15pm - Apache Geode, and Pivotal's leadership role in open sourcing Geode by Nitin Lamba

9:55pm - Q&A


10:05pm - Details of integration of Apache Apex with Apache Geode by Ashish Tadose

10:35: Q&A

10:45pm - A demo of a big data AdTech pipeline that shows ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop using Apex. Compute and transformations using Apex and finally a load (egress) int Geode by Vitthal Gogate 

11:20pm - Q&A

Sponsored by Ampool

Talk #1: Title - Apex & Geode In-memory computation, storage & analysis 

Abstract: Apache Apex & Apache Geode are two very promising incubating open source projects, combined they promise to fill gaps of existing big data analytics platforms.

Apache Geode provides a database-like consistency model, reliable transaction processing and a shared-nothing architecture to maintain very low latency performance with high concurrency processing. 

In this session we will talk about use cases and on-going efforts of integrating Apex and Geode to build scallable & fault tolerant RealTime streaming applications that ingest from various sources and egress to Geode.

Use case 1 - Geode as data store to write streaming processed data computed by Apex which is powering user applications or dashboards. 

Use case 2 - Apex application reading data from Geode cache and use it for data processing.

Use case 3 - Apex platform's operator checkpointing in Geode to improve performance of Apex batch operations.

Bio: Ashish Tadose is a technical lead at  Ampool, and worked at PubMatic, as a Lead Engineer, Big Data & Analytics, where he led a team driving large scale data ingestion and real-time streaming analytics solutions. Ashish is experienced in design & implementation of scalable streaming analytics technologies such as Apache Storm, Kafka, Kinesis, Flink, Spark Streaming & Apex. Ashish also delivered data infrastructure to facilitate large scale data ingestion from 6 geographic regions in both AWS cloud and in-prem using Kafka and Apex. Prior to PubMatic, Ashish worked at Verisign as Senior Software Engineer in Big Data Team where he worked on projects which required large scale data processing using Hadoop and MapReduce. Ashish holds Bachelors and Masters degree in Computer Science and passionate about development of products leveraging distributed computing platforms. 

Talk #2: Title - Pivotal's effort on Apache Geode by Nitin Lamba

Abstract: Nitin will discuss rationale behind Apache Geode and walk through the leadership role played by Pivotal in OSS efforts of Apache Geode.

Bio: Nitin Lamba is co-founder and head of products at Ampool. He is a veteran in big data and distributed computing

Talks #3: Title – AdTech Pipeline: Kafka->Apex->Geode

Abstract: Demonstration of a common big data AdTech data pipeline using Kafka, Apex, and Geode. The data source is Kafka, and Geode is used to store results of computations. Data will be ingested into Hadoop using Kafka input connector from Apache Malhar. Computations and transformations will then be performed on this data by an Apache Apex application that runs natively in Hadoop. The results are then loaded (egressed) into Geode for UI queries.

Bio: Vitthal Gogate is a Hadoop veteran who has worked on various Hadoop components. His work experience includes Senior Research staff engineer at IBM; Solutions Architect role in Yahoo! Hadoop; Chief Architect and Product Manager of Pivotal Hadoop Distribution; Architect for Hadoop Installation, Management & Monitoring product at Hortonworks. Vitthal founded the Open Source project “Apache Ambari” and serve as a PMC member and Committer for it in Apache open source foundation. Vitthal is also the main contributor to Vaidya – a performance advisor framework for MapReduce.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE.  Technically the sunrise will be around 7 am so this is more of a pre dawn hike until daylight adjusts.   This hike is  a fast pace and we will be at the summit a while before sunrise.  So those who wish to move a little slower have the opportunity to hang out on top.  Expect to possibly be hiking alone if you are slow.  Know the route.

 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.  From there we continue to the Firetower.  


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:45 AM.  Don't be late we will not wait.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.

results.description:
Join the Building Energy Exchange (BEEx) for a four-part training series on lighting retrofits:Green Light. From energy code and regulation consideration, and selection of LED and controls technology, to the development of the right retrofit strategy - the Green Light series provides building industry stakeholders the information they need to execute successful lighting retrofits. 

- Click Here to Register - 

The courses include:
Lighting Codes & Regulations: A survey of the lighting requirements of NYC and NYS energy codes, as well as local laws and regulations that impact lighting systems, including an overview of the Greener, Greater Buildings Plan.

LED Lighting - Evaluation & Selection: Guidance on the operation and selection of LED luminaires, with special focus on light output efficacy, color, and expected life, as well as replacement strategies.

Advanced Controls - Types & Functions: Guidance on the benefits and differences of available control typologies, with emphasis on maximizing functionality and savings through appropriate application.

Lighting Retrofits - Strategies & Applications: Guidance on planning and executing lighting retrofits within a "Good, Better, or Better Yet" framework, with emphasis on the cost effectiveness and relative benefits of the solutions.

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Green Light Training Series (BEEx Event)

results.description:
Come have coffee with me! I'll talk about the journey of The Phat Startup, How to build your own, and the new book!

Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Anthony Fraiser come and share his journey. (Special thanks to Daren McKelvey ([masked]) at R1 Labs for the intro)

Anthony Frasier is best known for being one of the savvy founders of The Phat Startup, an integrated media company that produces resources for aspiring entrepreneurs. By leveraging Lean Startup methodology and drawing on the connections between entrepreneurship and hip hop, you can credit Frasier and his team for successfully creating the critically acclaimed Tech808 conference that highlighted some of the best minds in business.

A serial entrepreneur, Frasier was the creator of a mobile startup called Playd and established an award-winning gaming site called The Koalition. As a freelance consultant, he advises, consults and coaches startups and small businesses on their product visions, business development efforts and social and digital media initiatives to propel their endeavors forward.

Outside of his work in the startup and entrepreneurial scene, you can find him actively involved in promoting a positive community impact for aspiring tech entrepreneurs in Newark, New Jersey as the creator of BrickCity Tech. His philanthropic initiatives have been recognized by the Business Outreach Center, where he was granted the Award for Entrepreneurship and Community Impact.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

Future events: 
** Office hours with Rubicon VC - Every Tuesday Morning ** 

3/25 - Gesche Haas (Dreamers & Doers) 
4/1 - Shayne Veramallay (DLA Piper Venture Pipeline) 
4/8 - Laurel Touby (Flatiron Investors) 
4/15 - Yuni Sameshima (Chicory)

results.description:
This unique safari takes place inside the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Although there will be artwork to photograph, this safari is about the use of light. 

The amazing Metropolitan Museum of Art features many would-be outdoor spaces that are now encapsulated inside the building (the American Courtyard, the European Sculpture Court, etc.). These spaces are beautifully lit by huge skylights, offering a unique opportunity to photograph several diverse architectural elements all in one setting.

For More Info & Tickets: https://goo.gl/AeQq0l
results.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art Photo Safari!

results.description:
We have been offered a discount to the annual Architectural Digest Design Show--  50% off the general admission tickets to the consumer show (normally $30 plus tax per person). Children are free and welcome. 

Click here to buy tickets (use code NYCDADS to get a 50% Discount on consumer general admission tickets) - you must buy tickets online to take advantage of this discount. The code will not work to buy tickets on-site.

More about the Show


Shop the latest in furniture, accessories, lighting, art, and kitchen, bath and building products from more than 400 leading design brands at the 2016 Architectural Digest Design Show. Be educated and enriched by three days of lectures and panels with design luminaries including George Oliphant (TV's George to the Rescue), HGTV star Genevieve Gorder, master pastry chef Jacques Torres of Jacques Torres Chocolate and designer Laura Kirar, seminars presented by The New York Times, and daily book signings, cocktail receptions and culinary demonstrations. Feast your eyes on DIFFA's Dining by Design, a showcase of jaw-dropping dining installations ranging from the lavish to the outrageous. Your ticket includes all of this, plus a full-year (12-issue) digital subscription to Architectural Digest magazine, ensuring your Architectural Digest Design Show inspiration continues for months to come.

Notes

• You must buy tickets at the link above. The code will not work on site.

• This is an event to enjoy with your family. We will not have a specific time or place to Meetup.

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

Most photographers see their work used without permission at one point or another.
We’ll explore the best ways to find copies of your work online, what steps to
take if you suspect your work has been used without authorization, and how to
resolve the issue. We’ll also look at common misconceptions about sharing
images online and how to protect your photos from unlicensed use.

Daniel is the Founder of Pixsy, an online service that helps more than 10,000 photographers find and fight image theft. Pixsy has grown to become one of the most popular resources supporting professional photographers worldwide. Daniel is also a professional photographer specializing in landscape, travel and commercial work.
results.name: What to Do When Your Photo is Stolen

results.description:
We're still working our way through Mark Seemann's Type-Driven Development with F# class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the third module -- Implementation, listed below -- plus have some discussion afterwards! 

Description

Learn how to use the strong type system of F# to your advantage – not only to check for correctness, but also in iterative development with short feedback cycles. You can use the type system to get rapid feedback about design ideas and implementation details, but also to get guidance on what to do next. Due to F#’s strong type inference, the type system of the language can be used in ways not available in C#, Java, or similar strongly typed languages. Learn how to combine the safety of static typing with the ease of development typically only offered by dynamically typed languages. The combination though, is even stronger than the mere sum of its parts.

About Mark

Mark Seemann is a Danish programmer based in Copenhagen, Denmark. His professional interests include object-oriented development, functional programming, and software architecture, as well as software development in general. Apart from writing a book about Dependency Injection he has also written numerous articles and blog posts about related topics.

Despite being a .NET programmer he takes most of his inspiration from sources across a wide range of technologies, including lots of pattern books.

Originally poised to become a rock star or (failing that) graphic novelist (in the European tradition) he one day found himself with insufficient talent for either, a master’s degree in Economics, and a desire for working with computers. He has been doing the latter intermittently since 1995.

When not working with software or spending time with his family, Mark enjoys reading, drawing and painting, listening to and playing music, as well as preparing or consuming gourmet food and wine.

results.description:
Grand Central Terminal Partnership offers a free weekly, no reservations required, award winning tour of the Grand Central Neighborhood. Approximately 90 minutes. I am sure you will learn some things that you never knew, and you will get some great exercise.

The tour meets (behind the glass façade) in the atrium of the sculpture court at 120 Park Ave.  Look for me wearing my ORANGE headband with the ribbons.

After the tour we will go down to the "International Food Court" and enjoy .....  getting to know each other while having a leisurely lunch.  There is a quiet spot way in the back of the Food Court where we will sit.  This spot can be found near the farthest wall (from the entrances)  in the corner, up a couple of steps.  You will pass Junior's restaurant - Mendy's Kosher Deli - Shiro of Japan -  near Fen Shui - Eata Pita -  and Hale Harty  Soup.  This little spot has a name but I can't remember what it is.

If the tour is too long or exhausting for you.... you can leave the tour and wait for the rest of us at the above spot. I love feed back so let me know what you think about this venue
results.name: Tour Grand Central Terminal ( FREE )And,   Enjoy a Leisurely Lunch

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins
results.name: Fun Fingers -PM Class 7

results.description:
Let's take advantage of the milder  weather and  head back "into the woods" at the beautiful Ramapo Mt. State Forest Park! We will take the blue trail, following along a stream with beautiful waterfalls, up a rocky moderate incline, hike across a stream and follow the trail down to the lake.  We will enjoy beautiful rock formations and vistas around the lake, including views of the Foxcroft estate remains, along fairly level woods trails. This will be about a 2 1/2 hour easy-moderate hike breaks included covering 3.8 miles.  

Weather resistant, supportive hiking shoes or boots are recommended for possible wet spots,  as are hiking poles, sun protection and bugspray and cameras of course!  WATER AND PROTEIN SNACKS ARE MANDATORY.  DON'T FORGET TO DRESS IN LAYERS, FOR THE WEATHER CAN CHANGE QUICKLY LATER IN THE DAY. 

INCLEMENT WEATHER CANCELS, SO ALWAYS CHECK THE DAY OF AN EVENT FOR ANY CHANGES.  Optional DINNER AT The Timbers, just down the road  in Oakland at 110 W. Oakland Ave. (201) 337-1615. Check them out at: thetimbersrestaurant.com / see photos too for restaurant  (Directions to Timbers: right out of park onto Skyline Dr. go straight and get into left lane for left turn in about a mile, onto W.Oakland Ave.  Restaurant comes up fairly soon on your left after bend in road. )

DIRECTIONS: 287 TO EXIT 57 SKYLINE RD., GO NORTH A VERY SHORT DISTANCE ON SKYLINE RD, BROWN SIGN FOR PARK WILL QUICKLY BE ON YOUR LEFT, WHERE YOU WILL TURN IN. THE PARKING LOT IS SMALL SO CARPOOLING IS RECOMMENDED, THOUGH HOPEFULLY DURING THE WEEK, IT SHOULDN'T BE A PROBLEM. THOSE COMING FROM JERSEY, COULD MEET EITHER AT THE DOUBLETREE INN ON RT 17, AT RAMAPO COLLEGE, OR AT A LOCATION OF YOUR choice.  There is also an additional lot up the street so we can shuttle people down if need be.  Come on out and discover the early signs of spring!  Lets' get movin'!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
We will be holding our 2nd annual Animation Jam on March 18-20, 2016 at The Art Garage. It will be held at our new studio in East Orange, NJ.

The purpose of this event is to bring animation creators together to create an animated short within 48 hours. You have the option to work as individuals or as a group. 

A theme will be presented on the first day of the event along with a storytelling workshop to get the participants ideas flowing. The goal is to provide an environment where animation creators (professional, student, and hobbyists) can network, collaborate, learn, and create a real world project under a deadline. 

Those interested in participating in the Animation Jam can do so in person or online (we will be live streaming the event).

The participants submitted videos and the animation jam documentary from last year’s event can found on our YouTube page below:

Animation Jam Documentary -
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLi_GUy9s824gM1xEdbq1I-NU6eDmZmFBo

Participant’s Submitted Videos -
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLi_GUy9s824inQtS8tGXtHObAweoeALf0

Here is the link to the event and promo video for more information and to sign up (The cost is $20): http://artgaragenj.com/pages/animation-jam-2016

Note: Updates will be posted up until the event.

results.description:
Good News: Get 2 days Learn to Ski/Ride, and get 3rd day FREE to be used in a future trip. 3rd day ticket includes all mountain lift ticket.

We are going to Killington Ski Resort - the biggest & best ski resort in NorthEast. Located in central Vermont, Killington has 141 trails and 21 lifts, extending across six interconnected mountain peaks. The main peak, Killington Peak (4,241 ft (1,293 m)), is the second highest in Vermont and has the second greatest vertical drop in the east (3,050 ft (930 m)) after Whiteface Mountain in Wilmington, New York (at 3,430 ft (1,050 m)). The mountains that make up the Killington resort separate the town of Killington (with its access road) from the city of Rutland, Vermont.

For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a full size bus so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating. All rooms feature micro-wave refrigerators, 32" Flat Screen TVs, Coffee/Tea maker, Hair Dryer, Iron/Ironing Board, Radio Alarm Clock.

New This 2015/2016 Season:  
* Room Renovations are 100% Complete!  
* All Guest Rooms- new EVERYTHING!
* New Lobby -Completed- New Guest Computer Room! 
* Free WiFi, Indoor heated pool and spa!


*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***


Depart Date: March 18th Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier. 

Depart 4:00 PM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 5:00 PM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 5:50 PM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17 - In front of parking garage entrance) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map) $2 to $4 daily parking at the parking garage on a weekend day. 


Return: Depart from Killington at 3:30 PM on Sunday March 20th and expect to arrive at NJ at 9:00 PM, NYC at 9:30 PM & Flushing at 10:00 PM.

Hot Breakfast (Included) - Eggs, Sausage, Toasting Breads, Belgium Waffles w/syrup, Bagels/Cream Cheese, Hot and Cold Breakfast Cereals, Yogurt, Bananas, Apples, Oranges, Breakfast Pastries, Juices, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Milk

Trip Includes: 2 nights accommodation at Comfort Inn Rutland. 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Killington. Luxury bus/van round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls & parking. 2 daily hot breakfasts.


Cost:
Early Birds: Limited Quadruple Occupancy (Includes Transport) $229; Double Occupancy (Includes Transport) $259 for first 26 spots or 21 days in advance; Regular $30 more afterward.

Buy Ticket Here: http://mar182016killington.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until you have prepaid the ticket.


Note: Quadruple Occupancy = 4 persons sharing a two Queen beds room; Double Occupancy = 2 persons sharing a two Queen beds room.


Additional Cost: 2 day equipment rental (skis or snowboard) is at group rate $70 (regular $120). $15 for 2 day helmet rental. $120 to upgrade 2 day lift tickets to 2 days Learn to Ski or Ride (lower mountain lift tickets, ski or snowboard rental & beginner group lesson & free 3rd day for future trip).

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Hello PlaySoccer2Give supporters,

As you all know we have NYCFC in town and we love their heart for giving back to the community. Learn more about how NYCFC is involving themselves in the local community here: http://www.nycfc.com/community

Please join us and other PS2G'ers at the NYCFC game against Orlando City SC and celebrate this awesome sport with a fun match at Yankee Stadium.

We have a limited number of discounted tickets (40) for this event in a great section (215) together and part of the proceeds will go to our charity network. 

If your full name is not in your meetup name please leave it in the comments section when buying tickets. (we pre-pack and label envelopes with tickets, we also need it if you are late and we need to drop the envelope @ will call)


This is a big group and the logistics are a lot for PS2G to organize we respectfully plead, beg, request… did we mention beg?… that you are early or on time (5:45-6pm) so we can make sure everyone in the group gets their tickets and gets in the stadium with as little hassles as possible. It does take some time to get through security so we want to be in the stadium and be able to have time to grab food/drinks before the game starts. You being late also means one of use needs to take more time to go to the will call office to drop tickets etc etc. So please be on time so we can all relax and have a great time. 

Please see the itinerary for the day so you can all plan your day out accordingly. Also, below is some info on transportation and some stadium guidelines for security to follow. Please read all and make sure you and you party joining us understand everything. Feel free to contact Chris W @ [masked] or[masked] with any concerns or questions if you are not getting answers in the comments section of the event but note that phone signals are not great inside the stadium so please contact me BEFORE we enter (6:25-6:30pm) the stadium.

The following is the day’s Itinerary :

before the meetup time ~4pm - some of us will be @ Bill’s Sport Bar [856 River Ave, Bronx, NY 104 (718)[masked], see picture #1 below] - If you would like to come early we will be here with some of the local NYCFC supporters groups, including “The Third Rail”, “Brown Bag SC”, "Bronx Football SC” and “NYC 12”. Enjoy some time with fellow NYCFC supporters before the game.

5:45-6pm - We meet across the street from Bill’s Sports Bar by Heritage Field (see Picture #2) We will have our Logo Banner to help you find us (see Picture #3) - Here we will meet up with our whole PlaySoccer2Give Group to do roll calls  and pass out tickets. Once we pass out tickets we can head into the stadium and get through security in time to grab a bite/drink and get to our seats before kickoff at 7pm. Please note: It is important to plan ahead to be here on time so we do not delay the whole group. Security lines will be long for this. 

Subways: the 4, B, or D trains all let off right by both Bill’s and our meeting location

The following is quoted from emails sent to me from NYCFC staff about Festivities, Rules and Transportation….. Please read all…  they are not every rule so if it’s not covered below and you have a question please ask.


1) Subway/Train: 


4, B and D trains all go near the Stadium but the 4 Train (161st St Stop) is the closest to the Stadium, Billy's Sports Bar and the pre game meeting location.

Metro North:Click the following link for some very useful Metro North Train info as it relates to the matches http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/mls/nycfc_mls.htm

2) No-no-no’s:·


Please do not bring your laptop otherwise you’d be turned away! No exceptions·

Any type of bag bigger than 16x6x8 will be turned away. No exceptions·

Security is going to be top level so please have patience, plan ahead, and understand it’s for our own safety

PICTURE #1 - BILL’S SPORT BAR LOCATION



Picture #2 - Meeting for roll call and ticket distribution on sidewalk by Heritage Field (see grey arrow on north side of the field) -Find us with our Banners here. Notice we will be down the sidewalk a little from the corner so we all have room for all 40+ of us to meet up safely




Picture #3 - the PlaySoccer2Give Banner to look for out our meeting location looks like this:

Picture #4 - Virtual View of our group seat location. Section 215

(Virtual Seat View from our group section: this is shown to approximate the view. )

results.description:
Nature, Politics and Humor
The Nature of Political Humor
William Kent [masked])
RECEPTION: March 18th, 6-9PM
In this tempestuous election year and explosive political season we offer a journey back into the sixties with world renowned printmaker, sculptor, and satirist- William Kent.
Psychedelic chameleons, alluring insects and bold political prints take us back to a time when things were..... pretty much the same!
We ask you to “End Your Silence” “Abolish HUAC” and “Take It Easy but Take It” in this second installment of our retrospective on the elusive Connecticut artist. The hand made prints were created by carving huge Italian slate blackboards, and reproducing on fabric and rice paper- without a printing press.
Five of Kent’s monumental wooden sculptures are also on display with content that reflects everyday items such as a hammer, shoe, key, shoehorn, and a crushed beer can. The rich illustrious hand carvings complement 32 prints in the second in a series of shows at New England’s diverse Six Summit Gallery
Kent, who many consider one of America’s greatest printmakers and sculptors, lived as a recluse. His work was included alongside such titans as Jasper Johns, Robert Motherwell, and Phillip Guston. He attended Yale University, was the first curator of the John Slade Ely House, and exhibited at some the
finest museums and galleries including-
The Wadsworth Atheneum, Sundsvall Sweden, Colgate, Brooklyn Museum,
Whitney Museum of American Art,
New Britain Museum of American Art and more. His work is in the collections of Smithsonian, Brooklyn Museum, Princeton University,
New Britain Museum of American Art, Lyman Allen Art Museum, Yale University Art Gallery, Florence Griswold and many more.
results.name: The Nature of Political Humor: William Kent Reception

results.description:
The first museum exhibition devoted to the Indian influences in Clemente’s work and how they relate to the artistic practices and traditions of various regions in India features approximately 20 works, including paintings from the last 30 years, and four new, larger than life-size sculptures created especially for the exhibition. In contrast to leading conceptual art practices of the 1970s, Clemente refocused attention on representation, narrative, and the figure, and explored traditional, artisanal materials and modes of working. Since his first trip to India in the 1970s, Francesco Clemente immersed himself in the country’s rich cultures as well as the everyday life and artistic practices of local people. Transforming ancient symbols, myths, and ideas, he has created a personal visual language of dreamlike landscapes, animals, and human figures drawn from recollections of his travels. Themes of sexuality, mythology, and spirituality, along with imaginary narratives of violence, intrigue, fragmentation, love, separation, and jealousy are seen throughout his oeuvre.

Every Friday the K2 Lounge offers a special pan-Asian tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and programs. Happy Hour runs from 6:00–7:00 p.m. with a 2-for-1 special on all beer, wine, and well drinks.

PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Our intellect acts as a filter, and in order to make good decisions, we need to have a good filter.  However due to external and internal interferences our intellects have lost its full functionality.


Are we in a 

mental positioning that will help us to keep on creating new opportunities

step beyond our non-visible limits to take risks and enhance our potentiality?

results.description:
Welcome New Comers:
At Indie R, we provide you with the community and resource to persist in the Quest for Liberty. We shall introduce to you an elevated view of the Constitution and the Madisonian philosophy behind the word ‘Republican’.

It's far easier to colonize Mars than to make NYC's ideological atmosphere breathable. We'll teach you how to terraform and thrive in a world that is presently inhospitable to your liberty. 

Organizer:
Critical intel from local and state politics. Actionable plans. With all the focus on Presidential politics, it's easy to forget how important local and state politics are. How might the landscape have been different if, just 20 years ago, back in 1996, a group of liberty lovers in Chicago had been able to stop the election to Illinois state senate of one young Barack Obama? What potential disasters are brewing here in NYC? 

Food & Catering:
We're keeping it simple this time! Swing by your favorite take-out place on your way. Or place a Seamless order after you arrive. 

Some possible choices nearby include: 
Whole Foods on 7th Ave between 24th and 25th. 

Hanamizuki on 29th between 6th and 7th Ave
http://www.hanamizukiny.com/#!food/c1jo3


Sunac Fancy Food on 6th Ave between 25th and 26th 
http://www.sunacfancyfood.com/main/index.php

The Corner Cafe on 6th Ave at 24th 
http://www.thecornercafenyc.com/menu.html


Round Table: 

We'll follow the presentation with a session discussing how to put what we've learned into action! We'll briefly touch on the latest developments in the Presidential campaign and brainstorm ways that events in this campaign can be leveraged to influence local elections. 

Social:

Make friends with other NY'ers who appreciate the professional danger and excitement of being a closet Pro-Free Market, Pro-Constitutionalists, Pro-American Exceptionalism in NYC!

results.description:
This is The New York Conservatives Meetup Group's 10th Anniversary meetup, Part 1 of 2 hosted by Sheila. You may show up for Part 1 at 6pm and stay through Part 2, or you may join us with hosts and Assistant Organizers, Doug & Natasha starting at 8pm.

The New York Conservatives Meetup Group was founded on March 19, 2006. We began with a half-dozen members ten years ago and have grown to over 380 members since. We hope that many of you can come join us for our 10th Year Meetup Anniversary on Friday, March 18, 2016.

Thank you all for your cooperation in keeping your RSVPs accurate and updated. (No one appreciates coming out to a meetup expecting X number of attendees only to find Y some didn't show.)

ABOUT:The New York Conservatives Meetup Group

WHO: We are a group of like-minded individuals who believe in upholding American conservative values fiscally, culturally, and politically. If you are a Conservative, Libertarian, Constitution Party, Neocon, Tea Party supporter or Republican, we welcome to you join our group and attend our meetings.

WHAT: We are a political and social discussions group, not an activist group, although activist members are welcome to join our group.

WHEN: We meet monthly, usually the 3rd Friday of each month, although there are occasional monthly exceptions as posted on this Meetup page.

WHERE: Our meetup is held at a restaurant in the Theater District, near Times Square in Manhattan. We chose this location for the convenience of mass transportation for all our Tri-State members, predominately those who reside in New York City and New Jersey.

WHY: Because we are sorely outnumbered by Liberals and Democrats in our Tri-State area. This meetup is intended for us get together to discuss and find common ground with each other.
results.name: The New York Conservatives Meetup Group -- PART 1 -- Monthly Meetup

Let's Get Social and Have FUN = True BLISS!!

We're mixing it up and hanging out at the very cool, Cafe' Serai in the Rubin Museum of Art. The energy of the Bliss seekers who show up fully, mixed with the energy of the Rubin are worth the visit. So inspiring!!!  Great way to turn around a stressful week,  celebrate a joyful one and make new friends!

COME FOR PART OR ALL OF THE EVENING!

This is one of my VERY FAVORITE places to gather in NYC.
If you have never been you will love it:
* The food is yummy-eclectic
* Happy hour = 2:1 house drinks, 6:00 - 7:00 pm
* There's a DJ (music, not dance)
* Museum is FREE on Fridays (tour @ 7pm) with an awesome collection of Himalayan and Nepalese art, and spirit-inspiring spaces (like the Tibetan Shrine room exhibit.


Check out the website to learn more about the activities: http://www.rubinmuseum.org
NOTE: Fridays are busy, so come early and get your food & drinks.

NATURAL NETWORKING: It is well known that people hire you because they "know, like and trust" you.  In this atmosphere, it is easy to relax, be yourself and authentically attractive.  This is about personal connection!  Try to avoid the dreaded & boring "what do you do?" question.  How about, "What's your passion?" to get a real conversation started, and find out how/if you and the other person resonate.


Come to have FUN, but bring your business cards in case someone wants to connect with you or learn more about you and what you bring to the world by way of your business.  Many profitable connections have already grown from these events, e.g., new clients, great resources, support networking and much more.

It's great to mix business with retreat & mindfulness. Playtime is key to creativity and productivity.  It's also a great way to nurture natural networking & nurture creative soul.

I look forward to meeting you for the first time, reconnecting and enjoying food, fun and drinks (alcoholic or non)

From my heart to yours,

results.name: [Social Bliss] Fun & Fabulous Evening Mixer (Natural Networking) FREE

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!


Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.

results.description:
Join us for the 1997 French film, My Life in Pink. Ludovic is a transgender girl who can't wait to grow up to be a woman. When her family discovers the little girl blossoming in her they are forced to contend with their own discomfort and the lack of understanding from their new neighbors.  A movie that addresses transgender and gender issues in general through the eyes of a child. 1 hour 30 Min.

Doors open 6pm for socializing and changing. Film starts at 7:30, followed by a discussion

Cross Gender individuals, their lovers and friends are welcome to this free event.  Respectful admirers are also welcome. Refreshments and drinks will be provided by Allison, but feel free to bring a bottle of wine and/or munchies.

The center has 5 well lit make-up stations if needed by attendees.

results.name: Join us for Movie Night...My Life in Pink

results.description:
Note: 

This is a German Movie Night presented by Goethe Institut. Many people simply go to see the movie, so don't expect as much socializing/meeting new people as on our monthly meetups. Sometimes a small group heads on out to have drinks afterwards though.

It is a public event, there is no specific area for our group.

The language of the movie is GERMAN, but it will have ENGLISH SUBTITLES. 

The movie starts at 06:30, please arrive early as sometimes the place fills up and it's strictly first come first serve. If you arrive late, you may not get a seat.

Master of the Universe (2013 - 88min.) - directed by Marc Bauder

Rainer Voss, a former investment banker, looks back on his job in this documentary about the megalomaniac and quasi-religious parallel universe behind bank facades.

Is there a Cover charge?

No, the event is free.

Do I have to speak German to attend?

No. Just keep in mind that this movie is shown in German, with English subtitles.

How do I get there by subway?

4/5/6 & N/Q/R: Union Square - 2 Blocks away

L: 3rd Avenue or Union Square - 2 Blocks away

1/2/3 & A/C/E & F/M: Transfer to L at 14th Street

To contact Goethe Institut directly about this event, you can call them at[masked] or send an e-mail to [masked] 

Please enjoy the event, and as always, please update your RSVP if your plans change, it is highly appreciated and helps more than you may think.


Thomas

[masked]

[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in through the library. There is no specific area for us, it is a public event. Get there early, the seating is on a first-come-first-serve basis.

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Join us the 3rd Friday of each month for networking and coding! 


Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-) 

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class (Swift) — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift 

• Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class (Objective-C) — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad 

• Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)
results.name: iOS Study Group, 3rd Friday @ Turn to Tech

results.description: Tens of thousands fill arenas and stadiums across America to hear a message of hope from Joel and Victoria Osteen. Now, the pastors of the largest church in America are coming to Newark, NJ to hold “A Night of Hope” at the Prudential Center Friday, March 18 at 7:30 p.m. Joel Osteen reaches one of the largest audiences in the U.S. and across the globe. Millions of people worldwide are inspired through his weekly television broadcasts, New York Times bestselling books, worship events, popular weekly podcast and now Joel Osteen Radio on SiriusXM channel 128. Joel and Victoria are the pastors of America’s largest church and one of the most diverse - the 52,000 strong Lakewood Church in Houston, Texas. Joel has been listed as one of the most influential people on Twitter in the New York Times. This Night of Hope will bring together people of all different backgrounds from across the region for an exciting time of praise and worship where lives are changed and hope is restored. Joel’s appeal is universal, allowing him to crossover to audiences that are diverse racially, politically and socioeconomically. His ability to speak directly to individuals and to connect personally with them is virtually unmatched today. And, his simple message that God cares deeply for each of us and empowers us to overcome and succeed resonates with millions, bringing hope and encouragement to a world that desperately needs it.
results.name: A Night of Hope...

results.description:
Event Type: Museum

Admission Price: Free

Description:

Asia Society Museum organizes groundbreaking exhibitions of both traditional and contemporary Asian and Asian American art.

The Museum, located on Park Avenue and 70th Street in New York City, is known for its Mr. and Mrs. John D. Rockefeller Collection of masterpiece-quality traditional Asian works.

The collection, universally described as "gemlike," includes objects from cultures across Asia that date from the 11th century BCE to the 19th century CE.

Asia Society Museum was one of the first American museums to establish a program of contemporary Asian art in the early 1990s. A recognized leader in identifying and fostering contemporary Asian and Asian American artists, the Museum announced the establishment of a Contemporary Art Collection in 2007.


Current Exhibition:

• Kamakura: Realism and Spirituality in the Sculpture of Japan

The magnificent sculpture of the Kamakura period (1185–1333) has long been considered a high point in the history of Japanese art. Stylistic and technical innovations led to sculpture that displayed greater realism than ever before. Sculptors began signing their works, allowing us to trace the development of individual and workshop styles that influenced later generations for centuries. Religious developments—often combinations of traditional and new practices—brought devotees into closer proximity with the deities they worshipped.

The icons in this exhibition commanded the faith of passionate devotees, some of whom hoped to gain merit from the making of a Buddhist image, to ensure salvation in the afterlife, or to obtain tangible benefits in this life. Others aimed to achieve ultimate awakening through ritual unification with the deity represented by the icon. In their original contexts these powerful icons were “real presences,” brought to life by their naturalistic form, ritual activation, and sacred interior contents.

Craftsmen created these icons during a time of profound political and social disruption. For the first time in Japanese history, powerful warrior clans challenged the imperial court that had dominated the political and cultural landscape for centuries. In the civil war of the 1180s, the great Buddhist temples of the ancient capital in Nara burned to the ground. The devastation shocked the entire country, but rebuilding and repopulating the temples with new sculptures and paintings began almost immediately. Renewed contact with the Asian mainland, which flourished in the early Kamakura period, further invigorated arts and religious practices.

Elite warriors became an important new source of patronage for religious arts, while the imperial court and aristocratic clergy continued their sponsorship of sculpture workshops in Kyoto and Nara even as their fortunes gradually declined. One major new patron was Minamoto Yoritomo, who became the first ruling shogun and established a military government headquartered in the town of Kamakura in eastern Japan. Later in the thirteenth century, however, the continued threat of invasion by the Mongol empire created further instability. In 1333, a cunning Japanese emperor launched a rebellion ending the Kamakura shogunate not even 150 years after its founding.

Despite the brevity of this historical period, it had a lasting impact on the political, artistic, and religious legacy of Japan. Shoguns and warlords were the dominant rulers up until the mid-nineteenth century. Even in the eighteenth century, sculptors proudly traced their artistic lineages back to early Kamakura master sculptors, while religious movements established during the period continue to be some of the most popular forms of Buddhism practiced in Japan today.

Reference Links:

http://asiasociety.org/arts/asia-society-museum

http://www.yelp.com/biz/asia-society-and-museum-new-york

By Subway: The Museum can be reached by subway: 1, A, C, E, F, N, or R, and the M on weekdays only. Take the 1, N, or R to the 28th Street Station. Take the A, C, E, F, or M to the 23rd Street Station.

By Bus: The Museum can be reached by bus: M20, M23, or M34. The M20 runs south on Seventh Avenue and North on 8th Avenue. The M23 and M34 are cross-town buses. The Port Authority Bus Terminal is at 40th Street and 8th Avenue. New Jersey buses go to the George Washington Bridge Terminal, and then take the subway or metropolitan bus line.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description:
Ecological Politics, Transforming World Views

Andrew will begin with speaking to this theme and then open the floor to general discussion and networking.

How to overthrow the corporate oligarchy by building  greater regional self-reliance. In a true democracy we will ensure public welfare before private profits! Create an economy that does not enable industry to pollute the water we drink and the air we breathe in order to give us jobs, start an ecological, socially attentive independent enterprise! 


Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup


Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
